Chynarkul is 51 years old. She has raised 5 children, all of whom are now grown-up, and only her youngest son continues to live with his parents and help his mother. As the main source of income for her family, Chynarkul has been farming and raising livestock for the past 30 years, having started this business practically from zero. Thanks to her hard work, Chynarkul's herd currently includes 2 dairy cows and 4 sheep and goats, and her business's monthly profits amount to approximately 20,000 som (KGS).

Chynarkul needs to develop her business and increase her profits. With this in mind, she has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 85,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cows in order to increase her income from sales of milk and dairy products. Chynarkul plans to invest her profits from this loan into further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 51 years old and married with 10 children. With 2 children in school, Norlita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, etc.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj is 52 years old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in Orhon province, Mongolia. His wife, Erdenetsetseg, is age 49 and works in their grocery store. His son, Chinbold, age 23, rents a mini-van and provides transportation services in town. 

Mr. Natsagdori and his wife have been renting the grocery store and have run the business since 2007. They have built a close relationship with customers and suppliers over the years. 

He is now requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase insulation material to insulate the grocery store building in order to provide comfortable and warm conditions to customers to please them. Both the borrower and his wife are hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material to insulate his grocery store building in order to provide comfortable and warm conditions to customers to please them.

loans.name: Tsedenbaljir

texts.en:
Mr. Tsedenbaljir is a 59-year-old widower who lives alone in an apartment in Orhon province, Mongolia. His wife passed away last year. His children have all gotten married and live separately. Tsedenbaljir has been running an organic dairy products sales business at a rental counter of the local market since 2003. He is well experienced in the industry and well known among customers. 

He is now requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell during the lunar new year time, which is high season for the products. He is a hardworking, thorough and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell during the lunar new year time, which is high season for the products.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 67 years old, married and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Purita has a general store business in the Philippines. Purita has been in this business for seven years.

Purita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, soap, spices, etc.

In the future, Purita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like noodles, eggs, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Zamirbek

texts.ru: Замирбеку  42 года, женат, имеет 2 детей. Замирбек в течении последних 10 лет  занимался животноводством в стартовав бизнес с суммы в 8,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Замирбека в его  хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство, большое количество скота.Ежемесячно от продажи молока и перепродажи скота Замирбек получает прибыль 20,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замирбек обратилася в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Он хочет осуществить свою давнюю мечту, приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en: Zamirbek is forty-two and married with two children.  Over the last ten years he started a livestock business with 8,000KGS.  Thanks to his determination the farm today is very far along, with many more cattle, and brings in a profit of 20,000KGS per month from milk products and livestock resales.  Zamirbek approached Bai Tushum for a 100,000KGS loan to buy additional cattle.  He wants to realize his biggest dream, which is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora. Her previous loan was a big help in her business and family expenses. She has had a food stall business for 15 years now and she has been able to develop a good relationship with her customers, who became loyal to her. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

Flora is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business. The profits from her loan will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. Flora looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

She hopes to have her own canteen and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Loribeth

texts.en:
This is Loribeth, She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items for her business. Her earnings were a big help in her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. In her five years in the direct selling business, she has been able to establish a good relationship with her customers. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Loribeth hopes to expand her business and have more businesses. She dreams to help her family to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.name: Rakhmatullo

texts.ru:
Рахматулло 48 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат, имеет 5 детей. Один сын находится и работает в Российской Федерации. Рахматулло имеет среднее образование. 
Рахматулло четыре года как занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи и пшеницу для продажи. Рахматулло берет кредит для закупа семян пшеницы и картошки, а также для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Rakhmatullo is forty-eight and has a big family.  He's married with five children.  One son lives and works in the Russian Federation.  

Rakhmatullo has a high school education.  For four years he has earned his living growing crops.  He rents a plot of land where he grows vegetables and wheat for sale.  He is seeking a loan to buy wheat and potato seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy wheat and potato seed.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 48 years old and married. She has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a buy and sale charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nora has been in this business for five years.

In the future Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en: Ni Komang wants to increase her business by keeping local pigs that she can sell to people who want to make roast suckling pigs. She needs a new loan to purchase three local pigs and their feed. Pigs destined for roasting usually only need to be raised for two or three months; then she can sell them. Her husband supports her business by helping her to give feed and clean the barn. Ni Komang saves her profits because she has a dream of renovating her kitchen. Two of the members of this group couldn't attend the meeting because they had a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and their feed.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
This is Leotina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of biscuits to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. This has been her business for ten years now. She also has an ready-to-wear business where she sells shirts, jackets and other similar products.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of biscuits. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and fund the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Leotina hopes to have her house renovated and hopes to expand her business and be able to serve others. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of biscuits to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Veronica Temilda

texts.es:
VERONICA TEMILDA tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

VERONICA TEMILDA se dedica a la venta de ropa. Solicita el crédito para comprar un refrigerador. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para su vivienda.

Los deafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. El sueño es culminar la universidad. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar fuera del país.
texts.en:
Verónica Temilda is 21 years old, single and has no children. She lives with her parents in the city of Chimbo, Bolívar province, and sells clothes for a living.

Verónica is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator. With this loan she will be able to buy what is missing in her house.

Her main challenge is competition. Her dream is to finish her university studies. During her free time she likes to travel abroad.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan is a 46-year-old widow with adult children who are married and living independently. She lives alone in a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. For many years, Bulgan has been working as a tailor at a local private company. She retired last year and is planning to start her own tailoring service at home. Bulgan has a great deal of experience and is well-known in her community for her quality products and services.

Bulgan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for her new tailoring business. She is hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her new tailoring business

loans.name: Ichinnorov

texts.en:
Ichinnorov is 42 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in small house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Along with his wife, Gegeensuvd, who is 34, Ichinnorov runs an organic dairy products business. They have been running this business for years and have gained many regular customers and have a great deal of experience. Ichinnorov has three children: a son, Buyandelger, who is 15; a daughter, Buyanhishig, who is 12; and a son, Buyantogtoh, who is five. His children go to local schools. 

Ichinnorov is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. He and his wife are hardworking, enthusiastic, and optimistic people.

loans.use: to purchase organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María vive en alquiler, la casa está ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la Ciudad de la Paz.

María, tiene un taxi con el cual genera sus ingresos ya que tiene un chofer que le da renta diaria, pero para aumentar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la venta de productos de toda clase como ser aceite de autos, electrodomésticos, ropa, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más aceite de autos y electrodomésticos ya que su chofer tuvo una embolia y ella tuvo que cubrir los gastos médicos y se descapitalizó. 



El sueño de María es tener su vivienda propia para lo cual va ahorrando día a día y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la quinta vez con IMPRO  y la cuarta vez que es parte de KIVA,
texts.en:
María lives in a rented house in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  María has a taxi, which she uses to generate her income.  She has a driver whom she rents to every day.  However, in order to increase her income, she sells all types of products like automobile oil, domestic appliances, and clothes, etc.

She is requesting the loan to buy more automobile oil and domestic appliances.  Her driver had an embolism, and she had to cover his medical expenses.  That is why her business is undercapitalized.

María’s dream is to have her own house.  That is what she is saving for day to day.  This way she will improve her quality of life.

This is the fifth time with IMPRO and her fourth with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more automobile oil and domestic appliances.

loans.name: Altanbagana

texts.en:
Altanbagana, 31 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been working as a mechanical engineer at a transportation and renting service for six years. Another income source for his family is renting of a microvan. His wife is currently unemployed due to eye surgery. His daughter goes to high school. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. Also, a coming Mongolian traditional celebration known as White Moon encourages families to renovate their houses because during this festival, Mongolians renew everything as a means of welcoming the new year. 

So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as cement, concrete, planks, bricks and gypsum. As a result, the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place and they can greet the White Moon festival with joy and happiness. In addition, during this period of year, construction materials are much cheaper than usual and a renovated house has benefits of not losing heat and preserving energy, thus reducing the consumption of coal greatly and thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Putri Mandiri group got a loan for the sixth time. The number of members is 14 and the total loan is 21,000,000 IDR. 

Having been successful with raising pigs, Ni Ketut will use this new loan to purchase four types of local pigs for pork roll and to maintain for two months. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase feed. The price of pig feed is currently very expensive, but she remains optimistic about this business going forward. With all the benefits she gets, she plans to repair her home.

loans.use: To purchase four types of local pigs.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn. She previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business for nine years now and it is continuously growing. She is working hard to provide income for her family.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of fabric, needles, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlyn dreams to give her children a good and quality education and hopes that her business will expand. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fabric, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Jhovie

texts.en:
Jhovie is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Jhovie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jhovie has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jhovie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Jhovie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Milma

texts.en:
Milma is married with children. For the past five years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines.

Milma is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials such as paint, wood, nails, and other items to repair her fishing boat. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, nails, and other items to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Vanesa es comerciante; su nivel de educación es técnico superior, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando 2 habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre (piso de madera) en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de la Paz.
Vanesa es comerciante de calzados, joyas, perfumes y chalinas y vende sus productos más de 10 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y su educación.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una laptop para sus estudios y así mejorar su nivel de educación.

El sueño de Vanesa es culminar sus estudios superiores ya que ella está estudiando comunicación social.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a merchant.  She has a higher level of technical education.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying two rooms with fine finishing touches and wooden floors.  She lives in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz.

Vanesa sells shoes, jewelry, perfume, and scarves.  She sells her products for over ten hours a day.  She does this in order to cover expenses for water, electricity, and her education.

She needs the loan to buy a laptop for her studies.  This way she will improve her level of education.

Vanesa’s dream is to complete her higher level studies.  She is studying social communication.

This is the first time with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop in order to help with her studies in social communication.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married and works hard to support her family. For the past five years, she has operated a fish-selling business in the Philippines.

Arlene is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married lady who is 37 years old. She has four children, three of whom go to school. Joyce operates a small retail shop in a rural area where she sells sugar, rice, and soda, among other items. Her husband is a farmer. Joyce started her business to supplement her family's income and she works six days a week. Her major business challenge is seasonality and the lack of capital. 

Joyce is requesting a 400,000 UGX loan to buy more retail stock. She hopes to get a good return from her business as well as meet her customer demand. In the future, Joyce dreams of seeing her family's living standards improve. She also hopes to educate her children with the proceeds from her business. Joyce also wants to see her shop expand.

loans.use: to buy retail items

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El señor Israel es empleado;  su nivel de educación es secundaria (high school diploma), vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando 2 habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre en la zona de Villa Fátima de la ciudad de la Paz.
Israel trabaja como garzón en un restaurante por 8 horas al día, para cubrir los gastos de agua, luz y su educación.

El crédito lo requiere para el aumento en la compra de una laptop para sus estudios y así mejorar su  nivel de educación.

El sueño de Israel es culminar sus estudios universitarios.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Israel is employed, and he has a high school diploma.  He lives in his parents’ house, occupying two rooms with fine finishing touches and wooden floors.  He lives in the Villa Fátima area of the city of La Paz.

Israel works as a waiter in a restaurant for eight hours a day.  He does this to cover expenses for water, electricity, and his education.

He needs the loan to buy a laptop for his studies.  This way he will improve his level of education.

Israel’s dream is to complete his university studies.

It is his first time with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to help with his university studies.

loans.name: Jinna

texts.en:
Jinna is the married parent of four children. She works hard to support her family. She runs a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling fish. Jinna has been sustaining her business activities with her 10 previous loans through NWTF.

Jinna is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: Gloria Elena a sus treinta y cuatro años de edad, casada, con dos hijo de 7 y 4 años de edad. Es una mujer, trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal, el cual desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para ganase el sustento de cada día. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega el cual está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Gloria tiene  una librería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace algunos años que se dedica a este negocio, Su rutina es trabajar unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos de librería a sus clientes. El propósito de este  crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y así aprovechar las ventas en este momento que viene la entrada a clases de los niños y jóvenes del país. Con el financiamiento comprar productos de librería como cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, resaltadores, reglas, borradores, lapiceros de colores, pega, papel lustrio.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena, 34, is married and has two children who are seven and four years old. She is a hardworking and responsible woman with a strong will to get ahead in life. Since she was young, she has had to work to support herself. Gloria was born in the Department of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Gloria has had a bookstore in his house for some years. She works for around twelve hours every day, offering different products to her customers. With this loan, she wants to invest in working capital and stock her business in order to take advantage of the school season, which is soon coming. She will use the loan to buy products such as notebooks, pencils, marker pens, highlighters, rulers, erasers, colored pens, glue and glossy paper.

loans.use: to buy school supplies like notebooks, pens, rulers, erasers and glue.

loans.name: Intatana Group

texts.fr:
Joseph fait partie du groupe Intatana et   habite à Bujumbura. Il  a   34 ans et est marié  à  Mireille, ensemble ils ont  4 enfants, âgés  de  1 mois à 10 ans, dont 2  étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de chaussures d’occasion   depuis  14 ans. 

Il  est à son sixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de chaussures   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait  être un grand commerçant qui importe  des produits d’Europe.
texts.en:
Joseph lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Intatana group. He is 34 years old and married to Mireille. They have four children, ages 1 month to 10 years. Two of their children are in school.

He has been buying and selling used shoes for 14 years.

He is on his sixth loan through Turame. He will use the KIVA loan to increase his capital and buy lots of shoes to resell so that he can earn more money.

In the coming years, he would like to expand his business and import products from Europe.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of shoes to resell so that he can earn more money

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been running her restaurant for the past five years and she also earns an income from selling frozen goods. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Helen is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 34 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has been running a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosalinda is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalinda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment for her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. She previously accessed a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures and in educating her children. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their family.

Elizabeth would like to apply for another loan (PHP 15,000) to buy cloth, thread, fabric, and other raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to give a good life and a future to her family. She dreams to expand her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, thread, fabric, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Choijingarav

texts.en:
Mrs. Choijingarav is 39 years old. She lives with her husband, her daughter, and her mother in a ger, in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Baatarsaihan, age 38, works at a local company as a woodsman. Her mother retired and stays home. Her daughter Anudari, age 3, goes to a local kindergarten.

Choijingarav has been working at a neighborhood grocery store for years. Now the owner is selling the place, and she is planning to purchase the grocery store and start her own business. She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to purchase the small grocery store and start her own business. She is a well-experienced, hard-working and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a small grocery store and start her own business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to resell, such as canned goods, soap, spices and soft drinks. Esther has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, before this loan.

Esther aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell in her store.

loans.name: David Otwary

texts.en:
David Otwary is a 36-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married, with three children between the ages of four and ten. All of them go to school. 

David runs a general store and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan Limited through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of SSP 2,000 to purchase more radios and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, David would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. David says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan Limited, through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like radios for his general store.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Lalita is 32 years old and lives in Bhaura-04 vdc of Bara district with her husband Ram and two daughters. They have been involved in hair cutting business (salon) in Kaliya.

Lalita has requested  a loan of 40,000 Nepal rupees (NPR) to upgrade the salon to make it nicer and attractive so her customers are more satisfied. Her husband, Ram, has over 15 years experience in hair cutting. He generally makes a profit of 5,000 NPR, which has allowed him to purchase a small plot of land and pay for their daughters' educations up to the 10th class.

loans.use: to pay for expanding her salon (hair cutting) business.

loans.name: Fony

texts.en:
Fony is a 28-year-old farmer. She is living with her parents and six siblings. During the rainy season she cultivates rice, but in the dry season she plants corn and vegetables. The farm is located in front of her house. To meet the needs of her family, Fony sells part of the crops, and she uses half for the daily meals of her family.
  
At the moment, Fony is cultivating rice; she needs additional capital to purchase a tractor, fertilizer and more seeds. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from TLM, amounting to IDR 10,000,000. Fony is hoping that TLM will provide the loan assistance, for her business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor, fertilizer and more seeds.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Maria Luisa has been in this business for nine years.

Maria Luisa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat -- for example, paints, wood, and nails.

Maria Luisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat, like paints, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 30 years old and married with 2 children.
Joan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and resells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Joan has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been trading in charcoal for 5 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.
Joan aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a 57-year-old married entrepreneur from Nailon, Tudela with 6 children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It started almost 6 years ago now and she earns PHP 3,000 a month. To improve her business, she is requesting to borrow an amount of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, she’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
Wilbroad is a 32-year-old man who raises pigs as his primary source of income. He fattens piglets up to 5 months and sells them off. He also buys pigs from farmers and sells them at a profit. His customers are pork roasters and bar owners from the city. He applied for a loan of 1,000,000ugx to buy feed for his pigs. He intends to stock maize and other feeds. These will boast the health of his pigs and help them grow faster.
Wilbroad intends to construct a modern pig sty for his pigs that has good drainage. This will also enhance the health of his pigs and he will spend less on veterinary care for the pigs.

loans.use: buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмону 33 года. Он женат, отец троих детей. Абдурахмон в семье единственный кормилец. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь земледелием. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 6 лет и хорошо освоил этот вид деятельности. Чтобы получить богатый урожай, Абдурахмон просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений (карбамид и селитра). За счет полученной прибыли он надеется сделать ремонт в своем доме.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is 33 years old.  He is married and is the father of three children.  Abdurahmon is the sole provider in the family.  He earns a living by farming.  He has been in this business for 6 years now and has learned it well.  In order to get a good harvest Abdurahmon is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer (urea and ammonium nitrate).  He hopes to use his profits to make repairs to his home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer (urea and ammonium nitrate)

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru: Ботиру 27 лет. Он женат и воспитывает двух детей. Жена Ботира работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Ботир занимается животноводством уже 4 года. Он покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает их и затем продает с наценкой. За эти годы он уже хорошо освоил эту деятельность и теперь собирается расширить свой бизнес. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Botir is 27 years old.  He is married and is raising two children.  Botir's wife works on a farm.  Botir has been raising animals for 4 years now.  He buys large livestock fattens it and then sells it for a markup.  Over the years he has mastered this business and now plans to expand it.  With this goal he is asking for a loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат 60 лет. Она вдова. У нее пятеро детей. Шарофат очень трудолюбивая женщина, она не боится трудностей жизни. Ее всегда интересовала животноводческая деятельность и вот уже 3 года как она занимается купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Сейчас ее мечта - сделать ремонт в доме. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит на сумму 1000 долларов США для купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет ее прибыли она хочет осуществить свою мечту.
texts.en: Sharofat is 60 years old.  She is a widow.  She has five children.  Sharofat is a very hardworking woman, she is not afraid of life's hardships.  She has always been interested in raising livestock and for 3 years now she has been buying and selling large livestock.  Right now, her dream is to make repairs to her home.  With this goal she is asking for a loan of 1000 US dollars for the purchase and sale of cattle.  Using the profits she hope to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to purchase and resell cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en: This is the second time Masika is applying for our help. since her first loan was successful and she has been able to expand her business and range of customers she now wishes to establish herself and open a shop that is why she has approached for a loan amounting to ksh.20,000.

loans.use: To buy coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 46, and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Neptalie, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes oversees their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Mercedes dreams of being able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children and grandchildren a good and quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.



* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance to their tricycle (motorcycle).

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo has requested a new loan for Ksh 50,000 to expand her food-selling business. She is grateful for the way previous loans have helped her improve her living standards by investing in her business. Her most recent loan helped her increase her sales, but she now hopes to increase them even the more. Mwanakombo is a mother who focuses intensively on her work and struggles to reach success since she has many goals to meet. She will use this loan to buy flour (both corn and wheat), cooking oil, sugar and other items.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a f0od-selling business.

loans.name: Delfa

texts.en:
Delfa is 49 years old, married, and lives in Jimenez with three children. She earns a living through seafood-vending. She has been doing this business for four years and earns PHP 5,000 per month from this work. 

Delfa has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 at Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more seafood products to sell. She is a new member of GDMPC. Delfa hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz  trabaja como secretaria; su nivel de educación es técnico medio, vive en casa propia ocupando  4 habitaciones en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de la Paz. Está casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una laptop para que sus hijos la usen en sus tareas escolares.

El sueño de Beatriz es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan ingresar a la Universidad.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Beatriz works as a secretary.  She has a middle level technical education.  She lives in her own house, occupying four rooms with fine finishing touches and wooden floors.  She lives in the Irpavi II area of the city of La Paz.  She is married and has two school age children.

She needs the loan to buy a laptop for her children to use for their school work.

Beatriz’s dream is for her children to complete their studies and be able to enroll in the university.

It is her first time with IMPRO and the first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for her children to use for their school work.

loans.name: Iryna

texts.ru:
Ирина  -  женщина фермер. С 2005 года занимается выращиванием огурцов, помидоров, редиски и кабачков.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 17-ти и 10-ти лет.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с  выращивания помидора и редиски в открытом грунте.
Ирина решила приобрести пленку для перекрытия теплицы, чтобы защитить огурцы, помидоры и редиску от холода и ветра.
В планах на будущее:  увеличить количество теплиц  для посадки огурцов и помидоров.
В личных планах: достроить дом для проживания.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования пленки для теплицы.
texts.en:
Iryna is a female farmer.  Since 2005 she has been growing cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes, and summer squash.  
Her husband and two children, 17 and 10 years old, help her with the farm.
The business started with growing tomatoes and radishes outdoors.  
Iryna decide to purchase film to cover a greenhouse in order to protect the cucumbers, tomatoes and radishes from the cold and wind.  
Plans for the future include expanding the number of greenhouses for the planting of cucumbers and tomatoes.  
Personal plans include finishing her home to live in.
She needs your help to finance greenhouse film.

loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: James Wani

texts.en:
James is a 46-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with five children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of them go to school. James   runs a general store, and has been in business for six years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers.

 He is taking out a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase more oil, soap, salt, and many other items, In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

In five years James would like to expand his business and open other branches. His   major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.

James says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like oil, salt, soap, etc

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 33 years old and has three children. Regina is married and has two children who are in school.

Regina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Regina has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child, two years old.  Alexander sells motor vehicle spare parts in Kapsabet and has been in this business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has borrowed a first loan of KES 30,000 from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and wishes to use this amount to purchase motor vehicle spare parts for his business. 

The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and provide for the upkeep of his family. His dream is have a bright future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor vehicle parts for his business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines where she works hard to support her family. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy spare parts she needs to maintain her motorcycle. She has been in business for nine years. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Donita

texts.en:
Donita is a woman who always looks for opportunities that will enable her to move forward. She takes advantage of every opportunity that she encounters. It is for this reason that she diversified her product line and now sells cereals. 

Donita is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support she has received. She promises that she will not let them down by making punctual payments on her loan. The current loan she is requesting is for KES 50,000. This will allow her to buy more sacks of dry maize, beans and rice.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dry maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Gulrakat

texts.ru:
Гулракат жительница города Сарбанд. Ей 58 лет. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж пенсионер. Двое ее детей живут отдельно и работают самостоятельно. Гулракат имеет среднее образование. Она одна работает и обеспечивает семью.
На протяжении шести лет Гулракат зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. В этой области она имеет богатый опыт. Гулракат берет кредит для закупа телят и корма для скота.
texts.en:
Gulrakat is a resident of the city of Sarband.  She is 58 years old.  She has six children.  Her husband is retired.  Two of her children live separately and are employed independently.  Gulrakat has a high school education.  She works on her own and provides for her family.

For six years Gulrakat has been earning money by raising cattle.  She has a lot of experience in this area.  Gulrakat is taking out a loan to purchase calves and feed for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase calves and feed for livestock

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who is 36 years old, is widowed with six children. She and her family live in Likoni Mombasa, Kenya. She earns her living by operating a food cafe. She says she started with a small store and later changed locations. Now she has her food cafe. It has gone very well for her. She attracts regular customers because of her longevity and the good service she provides.

Mariam is requesting a loan to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables and other supplies for her business because these are the most popular items.

She's grateful for the help she receives because it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods, vegetables and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Grace has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy a new fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

Grace has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Grace would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is a 60-year-old widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell, including shampoo and groceries. Dolores has been in this business for 30 years and her goal for the future is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 47-year-old married lady who supports a family of seven. Her five children are between the ages of 3 and 24. Rhoda has been selling cereals for the past 16 years, earning an income of KES 9,000.

She is servicing her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to purchase five bags of dry beans and 10 bags of dry maize for resale.

The profits she earns will be used to pay the school fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to ensure her business expands and her children receive a better education.

loans.use: To purchase stock of dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa, age 35, is a merchant who prepares and sells foods and beverages in a food stall. She is the mother of two children and is originally from the town of Likoni. She has been working for three years in this line of work. She has the support of her cousin. Her expectations include being able to grow her business.

Mejumaa is in need of a loan, so that she can buy the supplies that she needs, such as firewood, tomatoes, onions, flour, cooking oil, and other items. Her future plans include having a stable and profitable business with very good customers.

loans.use: to buy the supplies that she needs for her food stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man, aged 67, and supports eight of his children, aged between 35 and five years old. He slaughters livestock and sells the meat in his butchery which has been in operation for a period of 20 years, earning him an income of KES 30,000.

John has joined a self-help group through Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and he is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He wishes to use this amount to purchase livestock for slaughter.  

The profits he gets will be used to construct a permanent house for his family. His dream is prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Dugersuren

texts.en: Mr. Dugersuren is 58 years old and lives with his wife in a 'ger' in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Dulamjav is retired and stays home. This borrower has retired after working at a local communication company for 32 years as an engineer, and he is now starting his own taxi service. He is requesting 4,200,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide taxi service in town. He is hardworking and a diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas consuming car to provide taxi service in town

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnacion is 40 years old and has eight children. Encarnacion is married and has three children who are in school.

Encarnacion is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Encarnacion requested a 19,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Encarnacion has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Encarnacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teodoro Alfredo

texts.es: Teodoro de 44 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia.  Teodoro se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como: maíz, frijoles siendo esta  su principal fuente de ingresos, Ha realizado esta actividad por mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Él es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos los cuales dan buenas referencias de su trabajo como de su persona. Cada año repite está actividad ya que es una persona muy humilde y de escasos recursos el cual no puede tener   otro tipo de negocio o trabajo. Este año al igual que los anteriores ha decidido cultivar la tierra y ya que la temporada de siembra está cerca él quiere estar preparado con los  insumos agrícolas necesarios  para cosechar los principales granos básicos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a esta institución, INTEGRAL, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios  para realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas,  etc. De esta forma espera lograr cultivar los principales granos básicos de este año para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 44 years old and lives in his own house with his family. Teodoro works growing basic grains such as maize and beans, which is his main source of income. He has been doing this for a long time and this is how he earns an honest living. He is a very responsible man, honest and dedicated to his work. He is well known among his neighbours who say good things about both his work and his character. Every year he does this since he is a very humble person and not well off, so he cannot have any other kind of business or work.

This year, like the ones before, he has decided to cultivate the land and since the sowing season is near he wants to be prepared with the agricultural supplies he needs to grow the main basic grains. This is why he is asking for this loan from INTEGRAL, since he cannot afford the investment. He will invest the loan in buying agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, etc. In this way he hopes he will be able to grow the main basic grains this year and be able to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married lady aged 34 years and supports a family of five members. Her children are four, aged between 12 and four years old. She owns a beauty salon in Awasi location and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

She is borrowing a first loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase beauty products for her salon. 

The profits she earns will be used to plough back into the business and start the same business in a different location.  Her dream in life is expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase weaves, braids, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Buyanjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Buyanjargal is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her two sons in a small house in the province of Uvurhangai in Mongolia. Her sons, Tomorbaatar, age 23, and Tomorhuyag, age 21, are university students. 

From 2005 to 2009, Mrs. Buyanjargal ran a clothing sales business in the local market. She has gained a lot of experience and earned customers' trust over the years. She has been working at a local company for a while and is now restarting her clothing retail business. She is requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her clothing retail business. 

She is a hardworking and modest woman who says, "It is getting close to my sons' university graduation and I need to work just a little bit more for it."

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her clothing retail business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 25 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Utua Agustine

texts.en:
Utua is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of them go to school.

Utua runs a general store, and he has been in business for eight years. He has no employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP, to purchase more items for inventory, like omo, soap, sweets, and many others. In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

Within five years, Utua would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost.

Utua says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan, through the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items for inventory, like sweets, tea leaves, omo, etc

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Сирожиддин проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Сирожиддин живет с родителями. Их шестеро в семье. Жена Сирожиддина домохозяйка. Образоание у Сирожиддина средне - специальное, он шафер. 
Сирожиддин четыре года как работает шафером. В свободное от работы время он занимается растениеводством, а также разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Сирожиддин берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, семян пшеницы и теленка, чтобы продолжит свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin lives in the Vakhsh region.  He is 25 years old.  He is married.  Sirojiddin lives with his parents.  There are six people in the family.  Sirojiddin's wife is a homemaker.  Sirojiddin has a specialized high school education - he is a driver.

Sirojiddin has been working as a driver for four years.  In his free time he grows crops and also raises cattle.  He has been in this business for five years.  Sirojiddin is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer, wheat seeds and a calf in order to continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, wheat seeds and a calf

loans.name: Mebekari

texts.en:
Mebakari is a 25-year-old single lady. She is from Likoni, Mombasa. She's a merchant and the owner of a food store. She has been doing this work for more than two years, and she has become very well-known among the customers who go there.

She is a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity because with it, she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 33-year-old lady. She is married to Silvester, and they have been blessed with three children whose ages are 14, 10 and 5 years respectively.

Florence supplies tea leaves to the community; she has been doing this business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD., which she will use to purchase more tea leaves from the distributor to supply to the community. 

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her hope is to have elaborate stock in her business.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves for sale to the community.

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
Albino is from Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old. Albino is married and has six children. To make a living, Albino owns & operates a business providing transportation services. Albino been engaged in his business for 10 years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Albino joined GDMPC. Albino is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase tires and accessories

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
This is Rosie, 62, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, and mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosie operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round, palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats, and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales, every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy a greater quantity of raw materials, like fabric, thread, and other materials for rug-making. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosie hopes to increase production and expand her business. She dreams of helping her grandchildren with their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed by her for rug-making

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 31 and lives in the suburban area of Kisauni, a neighborhood in the city of Mombasa. Here she started her business selling African foods and beverages. She says that her business is doing well and she hopes to grow it so that it can attract more customers in future.

Mwanajuma is applying for a Kiva loan to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy the necessary ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 58 years old, married, and has seven children. She runs a shop and has been in business for the past ten years. She also practices farming and sells cereals. She is very hard working. Faulu Kenya has helped her become financially stable.

Someday Veronica hopes to expand her farming activities so that she can grow more maize. She is requesting a loan of 32,298 KES to buy farm chemicals and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals and seedlings

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 27 years old and a widow supporting her five children, who are between the ages of 3 and 14 years old. She keeps livestock and poultry on her farm, which has been in operation for a period of five years. She earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

Caroline has borrowed a fifth loan of KES 25,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase a dairy cow and chicks for rearing. She will sell the products from these animals to nearby markets.  

She will use her anticipated earnings to pay school fees for her school-going children. Caroline's dream is to own a large poultry farm in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more livestock and poultry

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живет в Виноградове. На 75 сотках земли он выращивает овощи и фрукты, а именно картошку, морковь, свеклу, лук и яблоки, которые потом продает. Торговую точку арендует на данный момент. Работает сам, наемных работников нет. Бывает Александру приходится трудно, потому что он не может найти спрос на товар и оказывается, что его некому сдать, тогда он сдает овощи и фрукты по более низкой закупочной цене на местный консервный завод. 
Александр планирует использовать полученные от КИВА средства в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы открыть овощной магазин.
texts.en:
Alexander lives in Vinogradovo.  He raises vegetables and fruits on 75 acres of land, specifically potatoes, carrots, beets, onions and apples that he then sells.  He currently rents his sales location.  He works alone and does not have hired help.  There are times when Alexander has a difficult time, because he cannot find demand for his products and he does not have anyone to sell them to, then he sells the vegetables and fruits at a lower price to the local canning plant.  

Alexander plans to use the resources he gets from KIVA, 10,000 hryvnia, in order to open a vegetable store.

loans.use: to open a vegetable store

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 41 years old and lives with her mother and four daughters in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She wants to start up a new business and has requested loans from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. Her requests were rejected because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Today the only source of income the family has is Inga's salary, which she earns by working as waitress in a restaurant. She makes 800 Laris per month. This is hardly enough to buy food for the family and explains why, by Credo's estimations, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Inga has requested a loan from a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo which helps people who are trying to start up a new business. The two organizations provide such loans under convenient repayment terms to help the rural poor. Inga plans to use the loan to go to Turkey to buy clothing from wholesalers and then resell it at a higher price to people who live in her community. This will increase the income of the family and allow it to improve its living standards.

loans.use: to open a new business selling clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and maize seedlings.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose, 29, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Single, she lives with her parents and helps them manage their household. She is also helping in generating income for their family. They have had this business for seven years now, and it is continuously growing.

Rose operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells different vegetables. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Rose hopes to make her variety store a grocery store and dreams to become rich. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Charles Wani

texts.en:
Charles is a 45-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 13. All of them go to school. Charles   runs a general store, and has been in business for eight years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking out a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase more oil, soap, salt, and many other items, In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years Charles would like to expand his business and open other branches. His   major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost. Charles says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, salt, soap, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, age 42, is from the Likoni, Mombasa. She's a merchant and the owner of a food cafe. She has been doing this work for more than four years, and she has become very well-known among the customers who go there.

She is a person with a lot of enthusiasm, who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for the dishes she prepares. This is what she most needs and uses every day. She's grateful for this opportunity, because with it, she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and food supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 47 years old, married, and has five children. With two of her children currently in school, Eden works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. She offers things like soap, canned goods and noodles. Eden has been in this business for one year.

Eden would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mwanajabu

texts.en: Mwanajabu, 53 years old, is a divorced woman from Likoni. She runs a kiosk which is well stocked with all kinds of essential goods and she has been in business for more than ten years. Mwanajabu is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family. Mwanajabu is seeking this loan to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, and vegetables so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, and vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and has been blessed with seven children. She operates a cereals shop and has been in business for the past 12 years. She also runs a butcher shop and she previously practiced farming. Mary is very hard working and diligent. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money for future purposes.

Mary hopes to become a wholesaler and open other outlets. She is requesting a loan of 63,585 KES to buy maize, beans, french beans, and peas.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans, french beans, and peas

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help regarding her child’s education, and personal, household and business expenditures. She has been in this business only a year, but she was able to attract customers, and her business is continuously growing.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store the better. More items will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes to expand her business and become as big as a grocery store. She dreams of buying her own house. 

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sonia has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 69 years old and from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married and has one child who is 18 years old and in high school.

Michael is a landlord and has been in this business for the past 10 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy iron sheets for roofing the houses he is building.

He hopes to have many houses in the near future and to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine started raising cows in the early 1990s but with only a few animals. When Ugafode Microfinance Limited started in Rukungiri, he joined so as to get money to buy more cows.This therefore boosted milk production on his farm.

He was able to get a loan and managed to buy a car in 2007, which he used to take milk to the dairy. Augustine also bought a solar system from one of the loans from Ugafode Microfinance Limited. He has also been able to educate his children and look after his family in a decent manner.

He now wants to buy more cows with the loan he is getting to increase milk production and earn more income. Thank you for the great services.

loans.use: to buy more cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is asking for a new loan to expand his existing business. Thanks to his efforts and the support of Kiva lenders, he has little by little taken his business into a high level. He has faith that this current loan will enable his business to flourish more and more. Boniface says that since he received his previous loan, his living standards have been improving and he can now count on increased sales. With this loan he will be able to renovate and expand his chicken house and buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his chicken house and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 41, is from Nyandarua South. He is married with four children who are aged between 7 and 17 years old.

John is a farmer and has been farming for the past 27 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and maize seedlings. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to become the leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38-year-old lady who is married and has three children. She has been in business for the past seven years.  She used her previous loan to add stock of medicine. Her business did very well and she repaid her loan.  Mary is an ambitious lady and hopes for excellence in the future. Faulu Kenya has helped her save for future purposes.

Someday Mary hopes to open a wholesale shop. She now requires a loan of 63,585 KES to add stock of natural medicine.

loans.use: To add stock of medicine

loans.name: David Flaminio

texts.es: David de 32 años de edad vive junto  a su familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hijo, un padre y esposo ejemplar  que sus deseos de superación siempre han sido altos, siendo responsable, honesto, humilde, trabajador y muy emprendedor. Se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos como maiz y frijol. Aparte cuando no hay mucha epoca de cultivo se dedica a la labor de ser jornalero, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a esta actividad y lo hace con esfuerzo y dedicación. David desea comprar insumos para seguir comercializando insumos basicos y que no se le arruinen por no tener lo necesario para cultivarlos es por eso que ha tomado la iniciativa de acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos como: Abonos, Fertilizantes, Pesticidas u otros. Espera que la ayuda que solicita se le sea dada ya que cuenta con buenas referencias de pagos y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
32-year old David lives with his wife and children. He is a man with an eye on the future, and that characteristic has always made him an exemplary son, father and husband. His wish to get ahead in life has always been great; he is responsible, honest, straightforward, hardworking and enterprising.

David earns his living growing basic grains such as maize and beans. As well, when there is not much work on his farm, he takes on jobs as a day laborer. Farming has been his principal source of income for several years, and he has put in a lot of effort and dedication. He now wishes to buy basic agricultural supplies so that his crops aren’t ruined. For this reason he has approached INTEGRAL to ask for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides etc. He hopes that he will be granted a loan as he has good references and expects to pay back the money early.

loans.use: buy manure, fertilizer, pesticides etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 41 years old and married, with two children.

Emelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail, coconut wine-selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the retail coconut wine business for 22 years, and she also earns an income from fishing.

Emelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Ariunbold is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia.
