His wife, Purevjav, age 33, has worked with her husband in a local shoe manufacturing company since 2005. His son Lhagvasuren, age 6, has just enrolled in a local primary school, and his younger son, Choijilsuren, age 2, goes to a local kindergarten. 

He has been working for a local shoe manufacturer for years, but now he is starting his own cobbler business on his plot of land. He is requesting 900,000 MNT to purchase leather and other inventory for his new cobbler business. He is hardworking, talkative and open-minded.

loans.use: to purchase leather and other inventory for his new cobbler business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Jennifer, 42, is a married lady blessed with five children aged between 8 and 20 years old. She sells fresh milk and has been in operation for a period of seven years. She earns an income of 7,000 KES per month.

She has borrowed a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she wishes to use it to pay the milk suppliers. She also wants to diversify her business and start selling cereals with this loan.  

The profits she earns will be used to pay the loan back. Her dream is to diversify her business and ensure her that children get the best education.

loans.use: to pay her milk suppliers.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 32 years old and has three children. She has been in business for the past five years and she is very hard working. Miriam used her previous loan to buy charcoal. Her business did very well and she successfully repaid her loan. She also weaves to earn an income.

Miriam dreams of expanding her business. She now requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 40 years old and married. She has four children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. She runs a retail shop and has been in the business for a period of 11 years, generating a monthly income of KES 6,000.

Everlyne has borrowed her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. With this loan she intends to purchase more stock for her retail shop. She anticipates earning profits which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She will use the surplus to expand her business. 

Everlyne hopes to improve her living standards, be financially stable, and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a very hardworking 46-year-old divorced woman with four children. She has been able to make improvements to her home and have a large number of products to offer her customers, thanks to her hard work.

Zawadi grows and sells farm produce, increasing her income greatly and allowing her to continue helping her family.

Zawadi is asking for loan so that she can buy more land to plant. This will allow her to continue working. She is grateful for the help she has received.

loans.use: to buy more land to plant.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is happy that his grocery store is doing well, but his aim is to see it grow into a wholesale business. He says, however, that his inventory has gone down and he lacks basic items. He does not want to disappoint his customers with this lack of goods. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to boost his working capital. With this new loan, he will buy more stocks of flour, basic grains, cleaning products, and basic medicines. He say thanks for the previous loan that increased his sales.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of flour, basic grains, cleaning products, and basic medicines.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 45años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol, y tambien cultiva loroco y jocotes. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y admirable lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos . Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado sobrevivir, puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos diferente a la agricultura. Como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere estar preparada.  Es por esta razón que solicita este préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos u  otros. Para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 45 years old, lives in a house she owns, together with her family. She works in agriculture, growing the main basic grains: maize and beans. She also grows loroco (a kind of vine with edible flowers) and jocotes (sineguela fruit). After harvesting, she sells part of her crop in order to meet her household needs which are increasing on a daily basis. She is an admirable and enterprising woman. Her priority is to earn a living in a dignified way, working with her hands. 

She has worked all her life in agriculture. This is how she has managed to survive as she has no other source of income other than agriculture. Like all enterprising and visionary women, she has taken the decision to approach this institution as the sowing season is starting soon and she wants to be prepared. 

For this reason she is requesting this loan from Integral, in order to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies, such seeds, insecticides, fertilisers, etc. This will allow her to start sowing as soon as it is possible and later to harvest the fruit of her labour. She is confident that the harvest will be abundant, which will enable her to improve her own quality of life, as well has her family’s.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, such as seeds, insecticides, fertilisers, etc.

loans.name: Douglas Alexander

texts.es: Douglas de 24 años de edad reside junto a su familia. Es un hombre visionario que lo que a él más le ha importado en la vida es dar lo mejor para su familia y que estos se lo agradezcan el día de mañana. Es muy trabajador se ha caracterizado por ser muy emprendedor.Actualmente posee una pequeña cosecha donde cultiva arroz, frijol, maíz . Buscando el bienestar de su familia Douglas desea ampliar más su cosechas, mejorarlas y que siempre sean las preferidas por los clientes  es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos básicos como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, abonos u otros .Siempre buscando lo mejor para su familia espera contar con la ayuda necesaria y así seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
24-year old Douglas lives with his family. He is a man with an eye on the future--for him the most important thing in life is to do the best he can for his family. He knows they will be grateful to him one day. 

Douglas is very hardworking and enterprising. He owns a small plot of land where he grows rice, beans and maize. Because he wants to ensure the well-being of his family, he wishes to increase production, improve the harvest, and always be the preferred supplier to his customers. For this reason he has approached INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, manure etc. As he is always seeking the best for his family, he hopes the loan will be approved so he can continue feeding and supporting his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, manure etc.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
This is Amalia. Her previous loan was a big help to her business as well as in the education expenses of her children. Her business is continuously growing as she and her husband work hard. She makes bed sheets, pillowcases, and curtains.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan that will be used in buying raw materials such as fabric, needles and the like. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Amalia dreams of expanding her business and having more shops. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña María Elena, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando, vive en San Juan Pueblo, la Masica, Atlántida.
Doña María tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, útiles escolares (cuadernos, mochilas etc.), achinería y refrescos. Hace 8 años que inicio este negocio viéndose en la necesidad de obtener otro ingreso económico que le ayudara  a suplir algunas necesidades, como la educación de sus hijos. Desde entonces trabaja mucho obteniendo buenas utilidades con las cuales ha podido hacer crecer su negocio. Trabaja tiempo completo vendiendo su mercadería. 
Ella  lleva varios financiamientos con ODEF en el cual manifiesta le han ayudado mucho en la estabilidad de su negocio, el que solicita actualmente es el quinto ciclo y es por 10,000 lempiras para surtir su tienda con mercadería como ropa,  zapatos, sandalias, cuadernos y útiles escolares.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para darles a sus hijos la estabilidad económica para sus estudios.
texts.en:
María Elena, 41, is married and has five children two of which are attending school; she lives in San Juan Pueblo, La Masica in Atlántida.  She has a business selling clothes, shoes, school supplies (notebooks, backpacks, etc.), low-cost novelty items and soft-drinks.  She started the business 8 years ago needing to have an additional source of income to help cover some of her needs like her children’s schooling costs.  Since then, she works hard earning good profits that have led to her business’ growth.  She works full-time selling her merchandise.

She’s had previous ODEF loans she says have helped her much to stabilize her business.  The one she’s asking for now is for 10,000 Lempiras to stock her store with merchandise like clothes, shoes, sandals, notebooks and school supplies.  Her goal is to continue working to give her children the economic stability needed for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes, sandals, schools supplies and clothes.

loans.name: Jercita

texts.en:
Jercita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Jercita has been in this business for 17 years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Jercita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Tita is 61 years old and has one child who is in school.

Tita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Yudis Maria

texts.es: Yudis de 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos desde hace 5 años, cuando inició su negocio con la expectativa de participar al mismo tiempo que generaba ingresos, en la educación y crianza de sus dos hijos, y en la atención de su esposo. Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar los gastos de su hogar y poco a poco ha ido agregando, además de medicamentos, artículos de miscelánea, que vende de contado en un punto comercial, ubicado en su propio domicilio en el sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su trabajo inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, de lunes a domingo y este gran esfuerzo ayuda a que su negocio crezca, logrando consolidarse en la comunidad objeto de su mercadeo. Desde hace 3 años ha estado vinculada a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en la cual ha sido apoyada, por 3 financiamientos con los que ha ampliado su negocio y aumentado el surtido de productos para la venta. Yudis con su esmerado trabajo, tiene grandes propósitos enfocados en el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida y el de su familia, para ello necesita hacer que su negocio sea cada vez mas rentable, ofreciendo una gran diversidad de productos que tengan pronta salida en el mercado; esta es justamente  la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, cuarto crédito que aplica a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos farmacéuticos de alta rotación, porque le generan un volumen de utilidades que le facilita aumentar su capital de trabajo, para reinvertir y ganar cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Thirty-five year old Yudis has been making her living selling pharmaceutical products for five years.  She began her business with the expectation that, while she was earning money, she would participate in educating and raising her children, and caring for her husband.

With her business, she has been able to help with household expenses.  Little by little, in addition to medications, she has been adding miscellaneous items, which she sells for cash in a shop located in her home in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  Her work starts from 7 in the morning to 9 at night, from Monday to Sunday.  This great effort helps her business grow, allowing her to become established in the community of her target market.

For 3 years, she has been connected with the programs of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in which she has felt supported.  She has had 3 loans, with which she has expanded her business and increased the variety of products for sale.

Yudis, with her conscientious work, has lofty goals focused on improving the quality of life for herself and her family, but she needs her business to be even more profitable, offering a great variety of products that sell quickly.  This is precisely the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her fourth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy pharmaceutical products that have high turnover, because they generate a profit volume that allows her to increase her working capital, in order to reinvest it and earn even more.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through providing transportation services. She has been doing this for three years so as to support the needs of her three children. She gets an income of PHP 10,500 a month from this business. 

For a 29-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Angie is borrowing an amount of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC Microcredit to repair her transport vehicle used in her business, and provide her children a better education. 

Angie joined GDMPC in 2012. Her plan for the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ganhurel

texts.en: Ganhurel, 32, lives with her husband and 4 children in small house in Ulaangom soum of Uvs Province, Mongolia. Her husband Nyamdavaa, 34, helps her with her traditional costume manufacturing business. He also sells them at a rental counter in a local market. Her sons Jargalsaihan, 11, Adiyahuu, 9, and daughter Gunselmaa, 6, go to a local primary school and her younger daughter Onormaa, 2, goes to a local kindergarten. The borrower has been manufacturing traditional costumes at her home for years and she has built strong relationship with her customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting 500,000 MNT to purchase inventory for her business to increase her sales during the highest season. She is a hardworking, friendly and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her business to increase her sales during the highest season.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
The client started the business in 2005 with the intention of supporting her family together with her husband, but later on she separated from him, and the responsibility of supporting the entire family remained with her.

Therefore, she decided to join Ugafode Microfinance Limited and get financial assistance. She joined the institution in groups where she got a loan to pay for school fees for her children. She was aiming to not reduce her business stock. With this particular loan, she will be able to buy stock of used clothing for sale.

Since she joined Ugafode Microfinance Limited, she has been able to educate her children and maintain her business.Therefore, in her words, Ugafode Microfinance Limited has educated her children, and now she intends to expand her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 57 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Daisy works very hard to provide for them.

Daisy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks and beverages. 

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to buy a vehicle for her business and repair her family’s home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and widowed with four children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like biscuit, soft drinks, detergent and school supplies.

Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like biscuits, soft  drinks, detergent and school supplies.

loans.name: Flor Del Transito

texts.es:
FLOR DEL TRANSITO tiene 23 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

FLOR DEL TRANSITO se dedica a la venta de comida ráìda. Solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor. Con las ayuda del crédito podrá comprar un telesisor para el hogar. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libr ele gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Flor del Transito is 23 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives with some family members in the city of Chimbo, in Bolivar province. 

Flor del Transito sells fast food. She is requesting the loan in order to buy a television. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy a television for the home.  

She makes her purchases in the city of Guaranda. Her dream is to improve her standard of living. In her free time, she likes to watch television.

loans.use: To buy a television.

loans.name: Dismar

texts.en:
Dismar is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Dismar is married and has two children. To make a living, Dismar operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. Dismar has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Dismar joined GDMPC. Dismar is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old and single. She Lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Gina owns and operates an auto repair shop serving customers in the local community. Gina had her business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 PHP. 

Gina joined GDMPC since last year and now she requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP to purchase additional materials used in her business. She plans to improve her family's living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials used in her auto repair business

loans.name: Rudiah

texts.en:
Rudiah is 43 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with four children who are between 22 and 10 years old.  They are all in school.
Rudiah is a farmer and has been for the past 14 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm.
She hopes to be the top farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует на крупном местном рынке женской одеждой и бельем. В ассортименте ее товара в основном куртки, кофты, блузы и т.п. У нее собственное торговое место, опыт работы в этой сфере бизнеса составляет уже 15 лет. Однако в КИВА Инна обратилась за потребительским кредитом. 
Инна давно мечтает сделать ремонт в кухне, тем самым улучшив свои жилищные условия. В ее планах использовать сумму в 22 000 гривен именно для этих целей, а именно выложить пол в кухне плиткой, рабочую стенку обложить кафелем, поклеить обои на стены, покрыть потолок гипсокартоном, а также поменять бытовую технику на кухне и кухонную мебель.
texts.en:
Ina lives and works in Melitopol. She trades at a large local market, selling women's clothing and underwear. Her products are mainly jackets, sweaters, sweatshirts, etc. She has her own shop. She has 15 years experience in this field. However, Inna asked Kiva for a loan.  

Ina has long dreamed of renovating her kitchen, thereby improving their living conditions. She plans to use 22,000 hryvnia for exactly this purpose: namely, to tile the kitchen floor, lay a tile back splash, hang wallpaper, drywall the ceiling, and get new kitchen appliances and furniture.

loans.use: improve living conditions by renovating her kitchen.

loans.name: Petro

texts.ru:
Петр использовал предыдущий кредит от КИВА по назначению: за счет этого увеличился его доход и он смог добавить еще два столика в своем кафе. Увеличение прибыли в процессе управления бизнесом способствовало улучшению качества жизни всей семьи Петра.  
Петру понадобилась сумма в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести новую кофеварку, микроволновку и некоторый другой товар для кафе.
texts.en: Petro used his previous loan from Kiva as he planned, and due to this, his income increased he was able to add two tables to his cafe. His increase in profit through good business management has improved the quality of life for Petro's family. Petro needs 15,000 hryvnia to buy a new coffee maker, microwave and some other goods for the cafe.

loans.use: buy a new coffee maker, microwave, and some other goods for his cafe

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. She is also doing manicure, pedicure, massage, hair rebonding and other services. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 30,000 PHP, to buy beauty products and hair products needed in her salon. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain their daily and business needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes to expand her business and wants to help her family financially. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Flora Ali

texts.en:
Flora is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Flora runs a small general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase tomatoes, beans, oil, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Flora would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Flora says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like tomatoes, oil, beans, etc

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 53 years old, is a married entrepreneur from Jimenez with four children and is earning a living from her transport service business. It started almost 5 years ago and she earns 3,000 PHP a month. To improve business, she is borrowing the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she just joined in 2012, to obtain accessories and tires. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and comes from Ndunyu Njeru. He is married with six children who are aged between four years and 17 years old.

Moses is a farmer and he has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy two heifers which will help him boost milk production in his farm. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to expand his dairy farming and be able to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy two heifers

loans.name: Leus

texts.en:
This is Leus. She previously received an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal, household, and business expenditures. This has been Leus's business for five years now and it keeps growing as she works hard.

Leus would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed in her store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Leus hopes that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zarnigor

texts.en:
Zarnigor is a very smart and active girl. She is 19 years old. After graduating from school, she was admitted to the university. She studies at the correspondence department of the Tajik University of Commercial. She is a student of the first course. 

Zarnigor lives far from her university. That is why she does not have enough money for transportation every day and why she studies at the correspondence department. She also works at a shop as a seller. She sells a variety of sweets such as candies, biscuits, etc. 

Zarnigor's parents are workers and do not have enough money to pay for her education at the university. She is asking for a loan of 550 USD to pay for her tuition. She is going to make her payments by herself. 

Zarnigor has great dreams for the future and awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Rosana owns and operates a farm where she plants and harvests vegetables and coconuts to sell. She earns 7,500 PHP each month. 

Rosan is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, seedlings, and young crops.  She joined GDMPC in 2012. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers, seeds, seedlings, and young crops.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается сельским хозяйством в Виноградове. У него есть 1 гектар земли, 3 теплицы по 3 сотки и ещё одна размером в 5 соток. Владимир занимается выращиванием цветов и капусты. Он берёт на работу наемных рабочих в период посева и сбора урожая, тем самым предоставляя работу односельчанам. Более того в бизнесе задействована вся семья и родители Владимира. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже 15 лет. 
Владимир с огромным удовольствием занимается этим бизнесом. Сумму в 10 000 гривен он планирует вложить в подготовку к новому фермерскому сезону, а именно приобрести семена цветов, пленку на теплицу и удобрения для земли. В будущем Владимир планирует достроить собственный дом, в котором живет с женой и 2 детьми.
texts.en:
Vladimir farms in Vinogradov. He has one hectare of land, three greenhouses which are 300 (meters long) and one which is 500. Vladimir grows flowers and cabbage. He hires workers during the planting and harvest, thus providing jobs for the villagers. What's more, Vladimir's entire family and his parents are involved in the business. He has been doing this for fifteen years. 

Vladimir takes great pleasure in his work. He plans to use 10,000 hryvnia to prepare for the new farming season. He needs to buy flower seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizer. In the future, Vladimir plans to finish building his own house where he lives with his wife and two children.

loans.use: buy flower seeds, greenhouse film, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Virgelio

texts.en: Vergelio is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Vergelio operates a family member's business providing motor transport services. He has been engaged in this business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2012, Vergelio joined GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline, 42, is from Kisauni. She is the mother of seven children and she is a merchant by occupation. She sells clothes at the market.  She hopes to grow her business and improve her profits to have more income and be able to invest more in her business.

Magdaline is asking for loan that will allow her to buy a bundle of clothes for resale. She feels that this loan will be of great use to her because her sales will increase, generating higher profits that she will reinvest in her business and use to do home improvements. Her future plan is to expand her business and she hopes that it will generate higher income so that she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Geovani Osvaldo

texts.es: Geovani de 20 años de edad habita junto a su esposa es casa humilde pero propia. Es un joven muy responsable, honesto y visionario que siempre se ha caracterizado por dar lo mejor de si para su familia. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, todas las mañanas se levanta con nuevas esperanzas de que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día, ya que es el único que trabaja y es el responsable de llevar el sustento diario. Geovani desea que sus cultivos crezcan y así las ventas de igual forma se vean más reflejadas es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, pesticidas, semillas, y demás. Confía en Dios que la colaboración llegue antes del tiempo de lo previsto y agradece a las personas de buen corazón que le harán llegar el préstamo adquirido.
texts.en:
Geovani, 20, lives with his wife in a humble house that’s nonetheless his.  He’s a very responsible, honest, forward-looking young man who has always stood out for giving his best for his family.  He currently works growing basic grains like beans and corn.  He rises daily with renewed hope that his home will never lack daily bread since he’s the only one who works and is responsible for producing daily sustenance.  

Geovani wants his crops to grow so sales will too which is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for  a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds and others.  He trusts in God that the collaboration will arrive ahead of time and thanks the good-hearted people who will see to his getting the loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticide, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Susana Elizabeth

texts.es:
SUSANA ELIZABETHtiene 23 años de edad es soltera  no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

 SUSANA ELIZABETH es ayudante de cocina,además se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, abonos, líquido mata maleza. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura.


Las compras las realizrá en la ciudad de Guaranda cada semana. El sueño es tener terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre le gusta compartir momentos agradables con la familia.
texts.en: Susana Elizabeth, 23, is single and has no children; she lives with her parents in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.  She’s a cook’s helper and also works in agriculture growing corn. She’s asking for a loan to buy supplies like manure and liquid weed killer.  With help from the loan she’ll be able to buy what’s needed for agriculture.  She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda every week.  Her dream is to own land.  She enjoys sharing pleasant moments with her family in her free time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure and weed killer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Milton Rodrigo

texts.es:
MILTON RODRIGO tiene 57 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívra.

MILTON RODRIGO tiene un camión para transportar maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar piezas para el carro, corona, frenos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá arreglar el vehículo para seguir trabajando.
Los defaíos a los qeue se enfrenta es la competencia y cuando se daña el vehículo.

El sueño es comprar un bus interprovincial. En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar y conocer otros lugares.
texts.en:
Milton Rodrigo is 57 years old, and is married with three children. He lives with his wife and children in Chimbo in the Province of Bolívar.

Milton Rodrigo has a truck to transport maize. He is requesting a loan to buy parts for his vehicle, gears and breaks. With the help of this loan he can fix the truck to continue working.

The challenges he faces are competition and vehicle damage.

His dream is to buy an interprovincial bus. In his free time he enjoys traveling and exploring new places.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle, gears and breaks.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito previously had a loan for 18,000 PHP, which he used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings helped  with his personal, household, and business expenditures.  To earn additional income, Lolito also repacks different condiments and sells them around the community using his bicycle.

Lolito is requesting another loan 20,000 PHP loan, which he will use loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, resulting in increased profits. His profits from his business will help him to sustain his family's daily needs. 

Lolito hopes to have his own house and dreams to expand his business.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Amoko

texts.en:
Amoko, 35, is a businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 and 10. All of them go to school. Amoko runs a general store, and has been in business for 8 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase more laptops, books, and many other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years, Amoko would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation costs. Amoko says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more laptops, books, pens, and other items.

loans.name: Zilpa

texts.en:
Zilpa is 33 years old and lives with her life companion and her five children, all of whom are attending school.

For the last two years, she has been selling rice in a store in her home. She started off small and then started to grow, thanks to the recommendations of her customers to other people. In this way she grew a little at a time. She considers herself to be a good entrepreneur. 

She is asking for a loan to buy sacks of rice to sell. She is thankful to Kiva and Yehu for the opportunity given to her as obtaining the loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en:
Zulaykho is 22 years old. She is a kind and hardworking girl. Zulaykho is not married and lives with her parents. She is a student of the 4th course at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She is one of the best students of the university, and she repeatedly takes part at competitions. 

She has a lot of friends, and all of her friends love her because she is a trusty friend. Zulaykho likes many subjects such as history, foreign languages, psychology, etc. She wants to be one of the best teachers in the future and to have many pupils. 

She must pay her tuition, but doesn't have enough money. Her parents also do not have enough money. She is asking for a loan to pay tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Katoi's Group

texts.en: Katoi is a 37-year-old husband and father of six. Katoi buys and sells livestock at the local market for a living, but faces the challenges of not having much capital to invest in his business and the poor market during the dry season. He joined KOMAZA to earn more capital to invest in his business, as well as to have money for educating his children. With the proceeds from his new tree farming business, Katoi aspires to build a rental house in the local town of Bamba to generate income. He was drawn to the KOMAZA program for a number of reasons: to earn the profit from his tree farm, to improve the environment and for the ease of working with the KOMAZA staff.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical training and plantation maintenance

loans.name: Gabriel's Group

texts.en: Gabriel is a 47-year-old father of seven. He and his wife are both farmers. Gabriel's business of poultry farming faces the challenges of seasonal market demand and diseases that affect his hens. Unreliable rainfall also negatively affects his agricultural endeavors. Gabriel joined the KOMAZA program to "change the environment of the area" by planting trees and earning money to support his family. He is currently sending five of his children to school and intends to use the proceeds from the tree farm to educate his family and expand his business projects.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
This is Cherryl. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She has been working in her general store for four years now. She also has an electronic loading business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another loan, 30,000 PHP, to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Cherryl's profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and meet her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cherryl dreams of one big happy family and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Mercedes Tarcila

texts.es:
MERCEDES TARCILA tiene 42 años de edad es soletar no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

MERCEDES TARCILA se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, balanceado, vacunas.   Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los animales y la alimentación. Las compras las realizará en  Guaranda. 

El sueño es ampliar el negocio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades a los pollos y la competencia.
En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes Tarcila, age 42, is single and does not have children.  She lives with some relatives in the city of Chimbo in the Bolívar province.

Mercedes Tarcila raises and sells chickens.  She is requesting the loan to buy chickens, balanced feed, and vaccines.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the animals and the feed.  She will make her purchases in Guaranda.

Her dream is to expand her business.  The challenges she faces are chicken diseases and the competition.

In her free time she likes to get together with the family.

loans.use: to buy chickens, balanced feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en: Peter is a 41-year-old farmer on the coast of Kenya. He is married with six children. As with many farmers, Peter's agricultural business faces the challenges of rainfall scarcity, pests and diseases, and marketing difficulties. He joined the KOMAZA program because "it's a long term project for future benefits." All six of Peter's children are currently in school, and he plans to continue to educate them with the proceeds from his new tree farm. Peter's favorite part about working with KOMAZA is that the program is "bringing people together." He looks forward to improving his agricultural projects with the knowledge and money he will gain from being a KOMAZA farmer.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en: Mrs. Sarangerel is 43 years old and lives with her husband in Ger, in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her husband, Bold, age 52, runs a transportation service in town. Sarangerel has been working as a tailor in a local company since 2003. She has a lot of experience in the industry and has built strong relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. She is now planning to start her own business offering tailoring service at home. She is requesting 2,600,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her new business. She is a hard-working and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new tailoring business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de edad,habita junto a su familia su esposa y sus hijos, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y decidido a seguirle brindando un buen futuro a su familia.  Con sus buenos modales y forma de tratar a la gente es responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar y todo lo hace pensando en sus hijos quienes son su principal fuente de inspiración para seguir adelante. Actualmente Juan se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos es así como honradamente se gana la vida, y hace que su familia posea grandes admiraciones porque se caracterizan por ser trabajadores y visionarios. El cliente desea comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos ya que se vienen épocas de cosechas y desea tener lo necesario es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de Semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Espera tener la ayuda solicitada para tener las mejores cosechas y venderlos como siempre lo ha hecho y que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Juan is forty-two years old and lives together with his family (his wife and children).  He is a hard-working and honest man, and decided to continue forward in order to offer a good future to his family.  With his good manners and way of treating people, he is responsible with his home obligations and he does everything with his children in mind, who are the main source of inspiration for him to move forward.

Presently, Juan makes a living in cultivating basic grains.  In doing this, he honestly earns a living and his family consequently has many admirers, because they are characterized as being hard workers and visionaries.  

He hopes to buy agriculture inputs for his crops, since the harvest season is coming up and he wishes to have what is necessary.  It is for this that he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, in order to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and other items.  He hopes to have the help requested in order to have the best harvests and to sell his goods as he has always done, so that in his home, they do not lack their daily food.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, pesticides, and other items.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru:
Юлия –предприниматель сектора малого бизнеса из Мелитополя. Она торгует на местном рынке ритуальными товарами. У нее давно есть свое собственное торговое место. Работает в этой сфере уже 16 лет. 
Юлия обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить венки, корзины и гирлянды для своего бизнеса. Юлия понимает, что ее бизнес всегда будет актуален, потому что население будет неизменно продолжать пользоваться ритуальными услугами. Она надеется со временем улучшить благосостояние своей семьи и сделать ремонт в квартире, если ей позволят это финансы.
texts.en:
Yuliya is a small business entrepreneur from Melitopol.  She sells funeral products at the local market.  She has had her own sales spot for a long time.  She has been in this business for 16 years.

Yuliya turned to KIVA for a loan of 15,000 hryvnia in order to purchase wreaths, baskets and garlands for her business.  Yuliya understands that her business will always be relevant, because the population will continue to use bereavement services.  She hopes to improve her family's living conditions with time and to remodel her apartment if her finances allow.

loans.use: to purchase wreaths, baskets and garlands for her business

loans.name: Roby

texts.es:
Roby es un estudiante de Ingeniería de Sistemas que se dedica al mantenimiento de computadoras y equipos electrónicos. Vive en casa de sus padres que lamentablemente no pueden pagar sus estudios y sus herramientas de trabajo. Vive en la zona obispo Indaburu de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo solicita para una computadora nueva que le ayude a hacer su trabajo tanto en la Universidad como al rubro al que se dedica.

El sueño de Roby es poder terminar sus estudios e independizarse para que sus padres puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en: Reyes is a computer science student who works fixing computers and electronic equipment.  He lives in his parents’ house who sadly can’t afford to pay for his studies and work tools.  He lives in the city of La Paz’s Obispo Indaburu zone.  He requests the loan to buy a new computer that will help him both with his university courses and with the work he does.  Roby’s dream is to finish his studies and become independent so his parents can live better.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Patricia, se dedica a la venta de empanadas y comida, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, el negocio de Patricia tiene 5 años de existir, lo atiende de lunes a sábado, su madre le ayuda a realizar ventas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la elaboración de las empanadas, comprándose plátanos, dulce, azúcar, leña y otros productos que sean necesarios para seguir realizando ventas, esta compra le ayudara para adquirir a mejor precio los productos.
La aspiración de Patricia es fortalecer el negocio y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Patricia works selling turnovers and food.  She’s 33-years-old, married and has three minor children.  Patricia’s been in business five years and is open Monday through Saturday.  Her mother helps her sell.  She’s requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make turnovers.  She will buy bananas, sweets, candy, firewood and other products needed to continue with her sales.  This purchase will help her buy the products at better prices.  Her hope is to strengthen the business in order to provide better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, candy, sugar, firewood and others.

loans.name: Asadullo

texts.ru:
Асадулло житель района Вахш. Ему 27 лет. Он недавно женился. Асадулло живет с родителями. У него среднее образование.
Асадулло занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый скот у себя дома. Также Асадулло занимается растениеводством. Она сеет пшеницу для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Асадулло берет кредит для обработки земли и сезонного посева пшеницы, а также для покупки корма для скота.
texts.en:
Asadullo is a resident of the Vakhsh region.  He is 27 years old.  He got married recently.  Asadullo lives with his parents.  He has a high school education.

Asadullo raises livestock.  He raises small, horned livestock at home.  Asadullo is also a farmer.  He plants wheat for sale.  He has been in this business for five years.  Asadullo is taking out a loan to work the land and for the seasonal planting of wheat and also for the purchase of livestock feed.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fuel and livestock feed

loans.name: Donaldo Antonio

texts.es: Donaldo de 37 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años.  Donaldo cultiva los principales granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles y maíz. Cada año repite esta actividad ya que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida. Es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora. Trabaja muy duro para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos  diferente a la agricultura. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar es préstamo a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra del abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y semillas, ademas desea reparar su pequeña parcela de terreno para tener mas ingresos.   Con mucha confianza en Dios y en su trabajo espera tener una cosecha abundante de la cual pueda vender una parte y dejar otra parte para el consumo. Espera cumplir su sueño de dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Donaldo, 37, lives in his own house with his life companion and their children.  He’s worked in agriculture for many years.  He grows basic grains like rice, beans and corn.  He repeats this activity each year since it’s the only way he knows to earn a living.  He’s a very hardworking, responsible and enterprising man.  He works hard to bring daily bread home since he has no other source of income besides agriculture. 

Because of this he’s decided to request an INTEGRAL loan to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.  In addition, he wants to repair his small parcel of land to earn higher income.  With much trust in God and in his work he hopes to obtain an abundant harvest so he can sell part of it and use the rest for home consumption.  He hopes to reach his dream of providing his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and seeds and also to repair his small parcel of land.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de los principales granos básicos como son: maíz y frijol. Después de sacar la cosecha  comercializa una parte de su cultivo para poder suplir las necesidades de su hogar que cada día son mayores. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y admirable, no se cansa de realizar esta actividad ya que para ella, lo más importante en la vida es ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente con el trabajo de sus manos y el sudor de su frente. Ha trabajado toda su vida en la agricultura y es así como ha logrado sobrevivir, puesto que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos diferente a la agricultura. Como toda mujer emprendedora y visionaria ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL ya que la fecha para empezar las siembras se aproximan y quiere estar preparada y espera recibir un prestamos: para invertir en la comprar de los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, insecticidas, abonos, u otros. Para comenzar la siembra lo más antes posible y poder cosechar los frutos de su esfuerzo. Confía plenamente que obtendrá una cosecha abundante la cual la cual le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
Irene, 30, lives with her husband and children.  She works in agriculture and her main crops are corn and beans.  Once she harvests them she sells part of her crops in order to be able to meet household needs that are greater every day.  She’s a very enterprising, admirable woman who does not tire of doing this activity because the most important thing for her is to earn her daily bread honorably by means of her own hands and the sweat of her brow.

She’s worked her entire life in agriculture and this is how she’s managed to survive because she has no other source of income besides agriculture.  Like all enterprising, forward-looking women she’s decided to approach INTEGRAL because the time for starting to plant is approaching and she wants to be prepared.  She hopes to get a loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, insecticide, fertilizer and others to start planting as soon as possible so she can then harvest the fruits of her labor.  She is completely confident that she’ll get an abundant harvest that will make it possible for her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, insecticide, manure, etc.

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay, who is 43 years old and a mother of four dependent children, happily lives with her household in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Her main business activity is growing rice, in which she has been involved for almost 20 years. She has great support from her children and husband, to ensure an abundant harvest in each season. Rice harvest has been her major source of income.

Hay is requesting a loan amount of 1,600,000 KHR to provide for the maintenance of her rice fields. Specifically, she will buy a cow to help her in her farm work. Her main objective is to improve her farm’s productivity, with the help of proper financing she will obtain from kind lenders. After the loan use, she believes that she will be able to earn higher income to cover her household expenses, and to provide a better quality of life to everyone in her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow to support her in her farm work.

loans.name: Mogga Mathew

texts.en:
Mogga is a 38-year-old businessman who lives in Nimule. He is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 12. All of them go to school. Mogga runs a clinic, and he has been in business for eight years. He has no employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers.

He is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase more drugs and many other supplies for the clinic. In addition to this business, he has no other source of Income.

Within five years, Mogga would like to have expanded his business and opened other branches. His major challenges include high market prices and high transportation cost. Mogga says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan, through the help of kiva.

loans.use: to buy more drugs and other supplies for the clinic.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Mr. Battulga is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters, in a small house in Sainshand soum, Dornogobi province, Mongolia. His wife, Gandulam, age 28, works at a local cafe as a waitress. His daughters Naranbileg, age 11, and Undrah, age 7, go to the local primary school.

Borrower has been working as a salesperson in a second-hand clothing wholesale business, since 2004. He has gained a lot of experience in selling second-hand clothing. Now he is starting his own second-hand clothing retail shop, at a rental counter of the local market. He is requesting 1,800,000 MNT to purchase inventory from a wholesaler, which he will use to work and start his own business. He is a hard-working, positive and communicative person.

loans.use: to purchase inventory that he will use to start his own business

loans.name: Jacob's Group

texts.en: Jacob is a 45-year-old married father of eight. He is a mason, building houses to earn income for his family. However, he says, "It's not easy to secure a job and payment is low." So Jacob is joining the KOMAZA program in order to "uplift the living standard of the entire family." Currently, Jacob is sending all eight of his children to school. He will use the profits from his new tree farm to continue educating his children and build a permanent house. He looks forward to being a part of the KOMAZA program because it will impart skills about farming to him, allow him to interact with KOMAZA staff and work in groups. Jacob joined the micro forestry program "to meet the KOMAZA objective: reduce poverty and improve the living standard of his family."

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Olziisaihan

texts.en:
Mrs.Olziisaihan is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Buyantogtoh, age 49, is a woodsman, and for years, worked at a state-owned furniture manufacturing company. Her daughter Sarangerel, age 28, helps her parents run their small business. 

The borrower has been producing organic dairy products and selling to local customers. She has five milk breeding cattle, and produces enough organic dairy products. She is now requesting 2,000,000MNT to purchase a large amount of forage to feed their cattle during winter and spring. 

She is a hardworking, communicative, and polite woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of forage to feed their cattle during winter and spring.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 42 years old and married with two children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc..

Aida has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from fish-vending.

Aida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Mwakaje

texts.en: Mwakaje, is 28 years old and is married with three children. She has been in business for more than two years, running a kiosk store which is well stocked with all kinds of essential goods, especially coconuts. She is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business. She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family. She is seeking this loan to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, vegetables, etc. so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, and vegetables

loans.name: Ezekiel's Group

texts.en: Ezekiel is a 49-year-old dryland farmer. He and his wife have three children, all of whom are currently in school. Ezekiel grows maize, cowpeas and green grams, raises goats and has a kiosk shop. Like many rural, dryland farmers, Ezekiel faces the challenges of drought and issues with transportation in doing business. He wants to become a KOMAZA tree farmer so he can earn money to support his family, build a good house, educate his children, and improve his farming activities by gaining knowledge from the tree farming program.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man, age 32, with two children who have not yet started school. He is a produce dealer involved in coffee and ground nuts, which he started as a major business to sustain the family. Paul is also involved in farming as an additional source of income; he operates these businesses in the outskirts of Kagadi.

He wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more coffee and ground nuts, since the season is now on. Paul hopes that if he invests more money into his produce business, he will be in position to realise a good return at the end .

Paul's major challenge are price fluctuations and the seasonality of the agricultural products. He would like UGAFODE Microfinance to always make funds available them whenever they have the need.

loans.use: To buy coffee and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en: Salma is a 22-year-old single mother of two. Salma's husband passed away. As a young widow, she is the sole provider for her family through the selling of agriculture produce such as mangoes and oranges. The challenges Salma faces with her current business are the seasonality of the agricultural produce trade and the perishable nature of her goods. She would like to be a KOMAZA farmer so that she can fund her children's education. In addition to funding her children's education, Salma hopes to start other businesses and build a good home for her family with the money she will generate from her KOMAZA tree farm.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Kuini

texts.en:
Kuini is a 59-year-old woman with five children. She has a store where she sells basic need products, like bulk grains, milk, eggs, meat, and other items. She already has a lot of customers who prefer her because of the quality of her products, accessible prices, and above all, for her excellent service.

She is an active and enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work. She has a lot of goals that she wishes to achieve, and is working hard to attain a more prosperous future. She feels very happy with her business.

In the previous weeks, demand has increased and it is because of this that she wants to make a new investment. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy bulk grains, instant foods/beverages, snacks, drinks, bread, etc. She has good payment references and is very responsible, assuring us that she will be able to pay off her debt while bringing economic security to her home.

loans.use: to make a new investment.

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en:
Bayaraa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small house in the Orhon province of Mongolia. Her husband Vanchin, age 43, and his son Monh-Erdene, age 20, work in Uvurhangai province as welders in a mining company. Her daughter Suvdmaa, age 16, studies at a specialty training school. 

Bayaraa has been running an organic dairy products sales business at a rental counter of a local market since 1997. She is now requesting 1,000,000MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, welcoming, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to sell to local customers

loans.name: Veronique

texts.fr: Veronique est une veuve agée de........ avec à sa charge 07 enfants.pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,cette mère de famille 'sest lancé dans la commercialisation des boissons alcoolisées tels que: les bières 33 export,mutzig,amstel,castel,guinness et autres.elle vend egalement la nourriture.cependant,elle sollicite un credit qui va lui permettre d'avoir un stock permanent,éviter les éventuelles ruptures de stock et si possible meme,profiter de quelques ristournes venant des sociétés brassicoles. elle compte se servir des bénéfices pour renforcer davantage son activité et améliorer ainsi ses ventes.
texts.en: Veronique is a widow, …[text missing] years old, with seven children in her care. In order to provide for herself and her children, she has started a business selling alcoholic beverages, such as various brands of beer: 33 Export, Mutzig, Amstel, Castel, Guinness, etc. She also sells food.  She is seeking a loan that will allow her to keep a steady stock, avoid depleting her stock, and, if possible, take advantage of some discounts from the breweries. She plans to use her earnings to strengthen her business further and increase her sales level.

loans.use: to increase her stock of  various brands of beer: 33 Export, Mutzig, Amstel,   etc

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu is a 71-year-old farmer and mother of 10. She grows maize and keeps goats, cows and chickens. Mariamu's agricultural businesses face the challenges of daily price fluctuations and drought that causes the animals to starve. Mariamu intends to use her proceeds from her KOMAZA tree farm to build a house and install power.

loans.use: to purchase eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer and to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Geturida

texts.en:
Geturida is one of the clients at Ugafode Microfinance Limited (MDI) – Rukungiri Branch, having joined in 2010 when she wanted to improve her agricultural business, especially livestock. She had decided to seek financial assistance from various financial institutions and Ugafode Microfinance Limited was the best of all.

With the help of loans advanced to her, Geturida has been able to improve her agricultural business and dairy products from her livestock. She has therefore been able to increase the family's income and to build a house for herself, her family and children.This loan will help Geturida to buy more cows to increase milk production.

Geturida thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance which has enabled her to improve her household income. She appears in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Murodbek

texts.en: Murodbek, 19 years old, is hardworking and determined. He is single and lives with his parents. Murodbek is a first year student studying in the management department at the Tajik State University. He is one of the best students and likes many subjects. His teachers know him as a smart and clever student. Murodbek must pay for his tuition but he does not have the money for it. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Davaatseren

texts.en:
Mr. Davaatseren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Ariunaa, age 35, works at a local school as an assistant teacher. His sons, Tuvshintogtoh, age 12, and Tuvshinbayar, age 10, go to local schools, and his daughter Oyumaa, age 4, goes to a local kindergarten. 

Davaatseren has been running an organic dairy products sales business at a rental counter of a local market since 2005. He is now requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products at wholesale.

He is a hardworking, enthusiastic and welcoming person.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products at wholesale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Victor de 44 años de edad vive junto a su familia, su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre con grandes aspiraciones y deseos de superación, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un buen trabajador y todo hay sido inspirado por su familia. Siempre el su hogar jamás falta el pan de cada día y esto lo hace un gran hombre, padre ejemplar y buen esposo. Victor se dedica al cultivo de frijol y maíz. Es un hombre que siempre ha trabajado y no descansa con sus cosechas  es por eso que se acerca a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así comprar insumos necesarios como: Pesticidas, Insecticidas, Abonos para que sus cosechas no presenten problemas y él los pueda vender de manera que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día y sobre todo que siga siendo el hombre ejemplar que es en su casa. Agradece a Dios y a las personas de buen corazon que le ayudaran a cumplir sus sueños y necesidades.
texts.en:
Victor is 44 years old. He lives with his family, his wife and children. He is a man with great aspirations and wishes to succeed. He has always been a hard worker, always inspired by his family. His home never lacks daily bread and this makes him a big man, exemplary father and good husband.
Victor grows beans and corn. He has always worked and is tireless with his crops. This is why he has contacted the field partner, INTEGRAL, to ask for a loan to buy necessary supplies such as: pesticides, insecticides and compost to avoid problems in his crops. That way he can sell them so his home will never lack daily bread and he can remain the good man he is at home.
He is grateful to God and the goodhearted people that will help him to fulfill his dreams and necessities.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as: pesticides, insecticides, and compost.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia, 34 years old, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is married and has five children aged 10, 12, 17, 19, and 21, all living at home and attending school. For the past two years, Lydia has been selling rice, charcoal, and oil in her community. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food for her household. Lydia faces the problem of a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil and bags of rice and charcoal for her business. Lydia's dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, charcoal and oil for her business,

loans.name: Armando Jose

texts.es:
Don Armando un humilde señor,  de 52 años, originario de Ocotal, pero actualmente vive en Estelí, soltero, padre  de 3 hijos entre las edades de 3, 8 y 18 años, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de café. Inicio  desde muy joven trabajando con su papa en la siembra, el cual adquirió experiencia y total dominio de la siembra, luego al morir su papa, le dejo de herencia la siembra de café, fue así que empezó a cultivar café por su propia cuenta del cual ha obtenido buenas cosechas y ha podido incrementar sus ganancias, este ha sido su primer negocio, él cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo, sus expectativas es ampliar el área de siembra para obtener mejores cosechas.
Él está solicitando el financiamiento para pagar mano de obra y comprar todos los insumos necesarios tales como abono y  fertilizantes. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar todos los insumos necesarios para darle un mejor mantenimiento a su siembra, sus planes futuros es poder comprar una camioneta para transportar su cosecha  a otros departamentos, con el objetivo de crecer como un empresario exitoso, una de sus meta es poder comprar más tierra para ampliar su siembra de café.
texts.en:
Armando, a humble man of 52, is originally from Ocotal, but currently he lives in Estelí.  He is a single father of 3 children who are ages 3, 8 and 18.  He is a farmer and earns a living growing coffee.  He started from very young working with his father in the fields, from which he acquired experience and total command of planting.  

Later, when his father died, he left him the coffee fields as his inheritance.  That is how he started to grow coffee on his own, from which he has obtained good harvests and has been able to grow his earnings.  This has been his first business.  He counts on the support of his son.  His hope is to expand the planting area to obtain better harvests. 

He is requesting financing to pay for manpower and to buy the necessary supplies such as manure and fertilizers.  Because he estimates that this loan would help him to buy all of the supplies necessary to give him better maintenance of his crop, his future plan is to be able to buy a truck to transport his harvest to other areas with the objective of growing as a successful businessman.  One of his goals is to be able to buy more land to expand his coffee fields.

loans.use: to pay for manpower and to buy all of the necessary supplies such as manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 29 years old and single, with a 9-year-old child who lives at home and is in school.

For two years, Christine has been selling door locks, door catches, nails and other items in her community. Less income is the problem she faces now.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day.

Christine is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, door catches, nails and other items for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, door catches, nails and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jasmine Group

texts.en:
Dian is the leader of a 4-member loan group called “Jasmine”. The group members live in Susukan, a village in the east near Jakarta. Dian, 41 years old, has three children: Sandra, 18 years old; Arjun, 15 years old; Lira, 12 years old.

Dian has a duck farm behind her house. After two years, she increased her farm, having started with only 20 ducks and now raising almost 100 ducks. Dian enjoys this business because ducks are easily maintained; they leave and come home by themselves.

Dian and her group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital . Dian will use this loan to buy duck food and to repair the coop. Dian's main obstacle in running this business is the rainy season, which produces many caterpillars which the ducks eat, whereupon they get sick and die. Dian dreams of sending her child to the doctor faculty.

loans.use: to repair the duck coop and to buy duck food

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is taking out another loan of KES 10,000 to boost her business by purchasing stock. She anticipates an increase in demand for clothes which will improve her income. Mwanakombo is grateful for the support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shella is 36, married, and has five children. She lives with her life companion and their children in their own house. She has a store where she sells common necessities: rice, beans, milk, bread, and eggs, among other items. In addition, to supplement the household expenses, she sells aluminum and clay pots. She has already been in this business for a number of years, and this has given her valuable experience that allows her to obtain the best earnings from her sales. 

She is very well known in the district since the store is well stocked and she always satisfies her customers. In addition, the products that she sells are of first quality, and she sells them at affordable prices. She is an entrepreneurial woman, very honest, and with great enthusiasm for advancing. She thinks that it is never necessary to abandon a dream, one should only try to see the signs that bring you to it. This is how she decided to apply to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to buy basic foodstuffs, candies, instant products, beverages, clay and aluminum pots, etc., for her store.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, candies, instant products, beverages, clay and aluminum pots.

loans.name: Hiyari

texts.en:
Hiyari is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 10,000 to expand her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase coconuts for resale, which will improve her monthly income to enable her to meet her family’s needs. 

Hiyari is thankful for Kiva lenders for the opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Carmene Chantal
