texts.fr: Carmene est une jeune femme agée de 33 ans .apres ses études,elle s'est lancée dans la commercialisation des vetements:notamment les pagnes et les sous vetements pour femmes.elle exerce cette activité depuis 02 ans environ.cependant,elle sollicite un credit qui lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de pagnes et de soutiens,afin de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle et éviter les éventuelles ruptures de stock.les bénéfices qui en découleront vont lui permettre d'étendre son activité en la diversifiant et aussi payer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en: Carmene is a young woman of 33 years. After her studies, she got started in clothing sales, especially pagnes (brightly colored wax cloth) and undergarments for women. She has worked in this business for around two years. However, she is asking for a loan which will allow her to increase her stock of pagnes and bras in order to better satisfy her customers and avoid potential stock shortages. The profits that come from the loan will allow her to grow her business in diversifying it and also to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy pagnes and bras

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para mejorar el local y tambien comprar productos para la tienda, ella reparara el piso con cemento, comprara lamina para cambiarla la que actualmente tiene, esto le ayudara a seguir prestando servicio en la venta de los productos domésticos.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio, utilizando los créditos para mejorar sus ventas y las ganancias, ayudando a su familia, en especial a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Yesenia has decided to ask for a successive loan to improve the premises of her shop. She also wants to buy supplies for it. 
She will repair the floor with cement and will buy metal sheets to change the ones currently on the roof. This will help her to keep providing service at her home products shop.
She has had a positive effect in her business, using loans to improve her sales and her profit, and helping her family, in particular her children, with their studies.

loans.use: To buy cement and metal sheets to improve the selling premises.

loans.name: Mwanaali

texts.en:
Mwanaali, 33 years old, lives with her husband and one child in Msambweni. She says that before she started her business she was employed as a shop attendant. Due to this job, she was able to accumulate a significant amount of capital and decided to establish her own business. Mwanaali and her husband built their house and decided to open a store with their savings. Thanks to effort and hard work, her business has expanded. Mwanaali now has a steady clientele because of the good and friendly service she provides her customers.

Mwanaali is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products, for her store.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as beverages, groceries, vegetables, etc. for her store

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 41-years-old woman who has been operating a food stall for the past ten years. She is a woman of high integrity who has been a role model in her community. She is a mother of seven children. Mwanajuma is an enterprising woman who has the urge to move forward in life. The loan she is requesting is for Ksh 50,000 which she plans to use to buy utensils, renovate the business premise and add stocks of ingredients.

Mwanajuma hopes to grow her business so that she can provide her family financial security.

loans.use: to buy utensils, renovate the business premise and add stocks of ingredients.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha, 56 years old, lives with her life companion and their six children in their own house. She has a store where she sells coconuts. Mwanaisha has already been in this business for a number of years, and this has given her valuable experience that allows her to obtain the best earnings from her sales. She is very well known in the district since the store is well stocked and she always satisfies her customers. In addition, the products that Mwanaisha sells are of first quality, and she sells them at affordable prices. This is how she decided to apply to Yehu for a loan that will allow her to stock her store by buying coconuts wholesale.

loans.use: to stock her store by buying coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Boriya

texts.en:
Mr. Boriya is 58 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Chuluuntsetseg, age 51, helps her husband to run his business of shoe repair in a rental place. His sons, Batbold, age 21, and Ganbold, age 23, are university students. 

Boriya has been running a shoe repair business in a rental place since 1998. He is now requesting 400,000 MNT to pay his son’s university tuition fee. 

Boriya is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to pay his son's university tuition fee.

loans.name: Ines Laure

texts.fr: Ines est une femme de 34 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant de 6 ans qui va à l'école. Elle gère une petite alimentation dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 an. Elle y vend des boissons hygiéniques et des produits alimentaires. . Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour pouvoir acheter plus de casiers de boissons afin renforcer son stock de marchandises (boissons hygiéniques)pour satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité et le reste sera injecté pour assouvir les besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Ines is a 34 year old woman, single and mother of one six year old child who goes to school. She has managed a small food store in an area of the city for a year. There she sells beverages and food products. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy more cases of drinks so that she can reinforce her merchandise stock to satisfy her growing customer base. The profits that this loan will bring her will be in part reinvested in her business, and the rest will be used to satisfy the needs of her small family.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Heha Group

texts.fr:
Théus fait partie du groupe Heha et   habite à Bujumbura. Il  a   32 ans et est marié  à  Francine, commerçante de boutique. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants, âgés  de  1   à 11 ans, dont 1  étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de bananes, d'ananas,… ; en même temps il vend le service de transport par taxi, depuis  13 ans. 

Il  est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de  bananes, d’ananas,…   à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait construire sa propre maison sur sa parcelle.
texts.en:
Théus is part of the Heha group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and is married to Francine, a saleswoman in a store. Together they have three children, between one and eleven years old, one of whom is in school.

Théus does business in bananas and pineapple. At the same time, he has sold transport services as a taxi driver for 13 years.

He is on his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy a lot of bananas and pineapples to resell, to earn more.

In the coming years, he would live to build his own house on his plot.

loans.use: to buy bananas and pineapple for resale

loans.name: Teresa Margot

texts.es:
TERESA MARGOT tiene 61 años de edad es casada no tiene hijos, vive en casa con unos familiares en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

TERESA MARGOT tiene una panaderia. Solicita el crédito para comprar harina, queso, manteca, levadura. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la elaboración del pan. 

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. 

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar por la ciudad.
texts.en:
Teresa is 61 years old. She is married and has no children. She lives at home with some family members in Chimba, Bolívar Province.

Teresa has a bakery. She is requesting this loan to buy flour, cheese, shortening, and yeast. With the support from this loan, she will be able to buy what is necessary to make bread. 

She will make her purchases in the city of Guaranda. The challenge that she faces is competition. 

Her dream is to improve her standard of living. In her free time, she likes to walk through the city.

loans.use: to buy flour, cheese, shortening, and yeast.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Don Alfredo tiene 40 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su familia en el municipio de la Masica, Atlántida. Don Alfredo realiza su propia actividad de generación de ingresos. El compra y vende ganado en la comunidad y a sus alrededores. Con las ganancias aporta al hogar para el sostenimiento familiar. Actualmente ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar ganando y venderlos, ya que no tiene el dinero suficiente para la compra. Su meta es darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Alfredo, 40, is married and has 2 children.  He lives with his family in the town of Masica, in the department of Atlántida.  Alfredo earns a living through his own business. He buys and sells cows in his community and in the surrounding areas.  With the profits he earns, he pays for the household expenses and supports his family.  At this time, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 Honduran lempiras to buy cows to sell, because he currently lacks the money to make this purchase.  His goal is to provide his children with an education.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Enilson Obdulio

texts.es: Eilson de 40 años de edad,  habita junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Él se dedica a la crianza de pollos y al cultivo de granos basicos. Es un hombre muy emprendedor y  trabajador. Lo más importante que realiza su trabajo con mucha dedicación y esto hace que las personas le tenga confianza. Es muy importante mencionar que estas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingresos por lo que trabaja muy duro para poder seguir recibiendo los frutos de su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL en la compra de insumos como diferentes: concentrado, desparasitartes, vitaminas, etc. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, y que ne su hogar no falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Eilson, who is 40 years old, lives with his spouse and children.  He raises chickens and cultivates grains and beans as well.  He is a very entrepreneurial and hardworking man.  The most important thing is that he does is working with great dedication, and this means that people have confidence in him.

It is important to mention that these activities are his main sources of income and that he works very hard to be able to continue receiving the fruits of his labors.  He made the decisions to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy different inputs, like feed concentrate, anti-parasitics, vitamins, etc.  With these, he hopes to increase his profits and to give his family a better quality of life, and that his home will not be without their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy inputs like feed concentrate, anti-parasitics, and vitamins.

loans.name: Holger Arnulfo

texts.es:
HOLGER ARNULFO tiene 51 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo e la ciudad de Chimbo Provincia de Bolìvar.

HOLGER ARNULFO se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para comprar un celular. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el celular que tanta falta le hace para estar en contacto con las personas del negocio.

La compra la realizará en Guaranda. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.

El sueño es seguir mejorando el estilo de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con los amigos.
texts.en:
Holger Arnulfo is 51 years old and married and has one son.  He lives with his wife and his son in the city of Chimbo, part of the province of Bolìvar.

Holger Arnulfo works in agriculture.  He is asking for a loan to buy a cell phone.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy a phone, which he needs in order to be in contact with others for  business.

He will make his purchase in Guaranda. The only obstacle he faces is competency with the phone.

His dream is to continue improving his lifestyle.  In his free time he likes to get together with his friends.

loans.use: to buy a cell phone.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Verónica, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, por la necesidad de aumentar el inventario en el negocio, se comprara churros, gaseosas, pan, condimentos, y otros productos de primera necesidad, esto ayudara a que ella se mantenga en el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior su negocio aumento sus ventas, mejoro sus ingresos, esto le permitió mantener lo necesario en su familia, adquirió un vehículo para su familia y para el negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica has decided to take out a new loan because she needs to expand her inventory in the shop.  She will buy churros (a fried traditional pastry), sodas, bread, condiments, and other basic groceries.  This will help her to maintain her business.

With her previous loan, her business increased its sales and improved its profits.  This allowed her to provide for her family's necessities, and she also rented a vehicle for use by the family and the business.

loans.use: to buy churros (pastries), sodas, bread, and condiments.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, se dedica a la venta de gas propano, vive con su esposa y una hija de tres años de edad, él inicio el negocio por la necesidad de llevar el sustento a su familia, comenzó con 20 cilindros de gas, ahora tiene 70, su horario es de 8:00am hasta las 5:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de un pedido de cilindros de gas,  para poder abastecer el negocio y mantener sus ventas, adquiriendo más estará incrementando el inventario para atender la demanda.
La aspiración de Juan es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, a través de su trabajo en el negocio, además de que desea a futuro comprar un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Juan sells propane gas. He lives with his wife and a three-year-old daughter. He started his business to provide for his family. He started up with 20 gas cylinders and now has 70. His working hours are from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.
He is asking for a loan to fulfill a purchase order of gas cylinders, in order to stock his business and keep his sales. By buying more cylinders, he increases his supplies to meet the demand.
Juan's wish is to improve his family's quality of life through his work in his business. He also wishes to buy a vehicle for the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: Mayra Sebastiana

texts.es:
Mayra Sebastiana de 45 años de edad, casada, viví en la ciudad de Masaya, lugar que está ubicado en la zona sur de león. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables, lo cual lo ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores en cuanto a la responsabilidad de sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su espíritu  y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos a los comerciantes de la localidad. La cual lo utiliza para elaborar comidas típicas de la región. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta, ya que se lo están dando a buen precio. Mayra  Sebastiana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mayra Sebastiana is 45 years old. She is married and lives in the city of Masaya, locate din the southern part of Leon. She is described as being a hardworking, responsible woman who has shown with previous loans that she pays them off responsibly. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, she was unable to go to college and had to work from a very young age to help pay the household expenses. 

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, her economic activity is raising and selling pigs to area merchants. They use the meat to make  traditional dishes from the region. The reason for the loan is to invest in working capital to buy a lot of pigs to raise and sell, since they are at a good price. Mayra  Sebastiana is grateful to the Kiva investors for offering help to low income people in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her pig raising and selling business to make traditional dishes from the region.

loans.name: Isiatu

texts.en:
Isiatu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 41, married and has five children between the ages of 8 and 27 years old that live at home. Three of them attend school. 

For three years she has been selling ice in the market. One of the problems she faces is a small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food. She is proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ice to resell. Her dream is to own a house for her children .

loans.use: to purchase more ice to resell.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is taking out another Kiva loan of Kshs 10,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan, she wants to purchase basic necessities to supply her store, such as beverages, vegetables, meats, breads and other items in order to keep working and offering good products to her customers. 

Binti is grateful for the support she is getting from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, vegetables, meats, breads and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bundle of mixed clothing.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Candida Rosa,  emprendedora y trabajadora, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las Cinco de la tarde. En un mercado capitalino, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada ella atiende su negocio junto a su esposo y su hija.
     
Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertirlo en compra de mercadería paca de ropa la cual le permitirá mayor variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes. así mismo esto le permitirá incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is hardworking and entrepreneurial, and she works daily from six in the morning until five in the evening.  In a market in the capital, she runs her business in used clothing sales, which she looks after alongside her husband and her daughter.

She is asking for a loan from Ceprodel to invest in buying merchandise, bundles of bulk used clothing, which will permit her to offer a greater variety to her customers.  This will also allow her to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Luis Arnulfo

texts.es:
LUIS ARNULFO tiene 33 años de edad es casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

LUIS ARNULFO se dedica  a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes. 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y la plaga en los cultivos. 

El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
LUIS ARNULFO is 33 years old. He is married and has no children. He lives with his wife in the Chimbo province of Bolívar.

LUIS ARNULFO is a farmer and grows corn. He is asking for the loan to buy urea, insecticide, liquid weed killer and ranger herbicide. With the help from the loan, he will be able to buy fertilizer. ranger. 

The challenges he faces are the competition and crop pests. His dream is to improve the quality of his housing. In his free time, he likes to play soccer.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticide, liquid weed killer and ranger herbicide.

loans.name: Mamu

texts.en: Mamu, 30 years old, lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is single and has a 5-year-old child who lives at home and goes to school. For three years, Mamu has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She spends 8 hours daily on her business and she really enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she gains every day. Mamu's small income is a problem. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (cups, bowls, spoons, plates, tubs) for her business. Her dream is to have her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 33 years old, lives with his wife and child in Dornod, an eastern province in Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Since 2002, Enkhbaatar has been providing hairdressing services to local people. His wife offers the same services in another barber shop. Their 2-year-old son goes to pre-school.

In autumn 2012, the family began building their own house with planks. Due to lack of finances, the interior work is not complete so Enkhbaatar is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as cement, gypsum, panels, etc. As a result, the family can live in a more comfortable and warm place. Enkhbaatar used his previous loan to open another barber shop and repaid the loan on an established schedule. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, gypsum and panels

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús,  es una mujer trabajadora, labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.

 En un centro de salud desempeñándose como enfermera desde hace 10 años  labora en esta institución del estado.
     
Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel  para invertir en  la reparación de su casa, lo cual será reforzamiento de paredes y reparación de techo. Estas mejoras le permitirán reparar su vivienda.

 este crédito lo invertirá en compra  materiales de construcción de cinz, cemento, hierro, arena,   de esta forma  le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia al mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is a hard-working woman. She works every day from six in the morning to three in the afternoon. 

She works in a health center as a nurse. She has worked in this state institution for 10 years. 
     
She is requesting the loan from Ceprodel to invest in repairing her house by reinforcing the walls and repairing the roof. These improvements will permit her to repair her home. 

She will invest this loan in buying construction materials, such as zinc, cement, iron and sand. In this way she will be able to continue improving her living conditions and those of her family, by improving their home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Adan Enrique

texts.es: Adan de 49 añosde edad  habita en casa de su propiedad  junto con su grupo familiar su esposa y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos es decir Maíz y Frijol . Este ha sido su negocio desde hace muchos años, y es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Adan es un hombre muy trabajador del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias.  Por medio del cultivo de estos productos es como puede ir subsistiendo él y su familia ya que cada año al sacar la cosecha pone a la venta una parte para sacar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. Su deseo es  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar su nivel de  ventas como sus ingresos. Esta es la razón por la  que tomo la decisión de acercarse  a INTEGRAL,  para invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas como: abonos, semillas,  fertilizantes, pesticidas etc.  Para invertir en la cosechar de una  mayor cantidad  de granos básicos y lograr el objetivo final de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que logrará resultados favorables.
texts.en: Adan is 49 years old. He lives in his own home with his family, his wife and children. He grows basic grains, that is, corn and beans. He has had this business for many years and it allows him to bring home the daily bread. Adan is a very hardworking man who has good references from a lot of people. Growing these products is how he and his family can subsist, taking out the harvest every year and selling a part of it to have the income they need for other household needs. He wants to invest a little more in the farming so his harvest will yield more basic grains that will allow him to improve his sales and income. That is why he made the decision to approach INTEGRAL, to invest in agricultural materials such as manure, seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.   with the ultimate goal being improving his and his family's quality of life. He trusts in God and in his work bringing favorable results.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, seeds, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para la compra de frijol para semilla, porque se dispone a sembrar, así como tambien cacao, tamarindo, pagara el alquiler del terreno y de ser posible tambien comprara un cerdo, esto le ayudara para que él siga realizando su trabajo.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, realizando la siembra de maíz, tabaco, frijol, y la producción fue abundante, su deseo es comercializar el cacao y tamarindo, en su familia se ha mantenido con sus ingresos, su deseo es mejorar la vivienda y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Héctor has decided to request a new loan to buy beans for their seeds, because now is the time to plant.  He will would also like to use the loan to buy coco plants, tamarind trees, and also pay to rent the land and buy a hog, which will all help him continue to do his job.

The previous loan had a positive impact on his income, as he was able to plant corn, tabacco and beans, which resulted in an abundant harvest.  He hopes to sell the coco and tamarind.  He has been able to support his family with his income, and he would like to improve their standard of living and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy beans, coco and tamarind to plant.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Naryani Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2012, Maa Laxmi Naryani SHG was formed with 12 women from a small village in Odisha. Banita is selected as the leader of the group. The lady who is sitting in the second position from the left side of the photograph is Banita. 

With the initiative of Banita they are doing monthly saving and solving their problem among the group. They are also taking part in the village decision-making meeting.

Banita is a 30-year-old lady living with her one daughter, one son and her husband. Her husband is involved in agriculture activities. He has nine years of experience in this activity. Because of the growing price of fertilizers and pesticides, they are unable to use fertilizers and pesticides as per the requirement and they are not able to pay the labour charges also. So Banita has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the labor charges. 

Banita says that this loan can help her to increase her family income and she can provide study materials according to the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay labor charges.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mr. Erdenetsetseg is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a 'ger' in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Enhtuya, age 39, works at a local company. His daughter Janchiv, age 21, is a university student and his daughter Dashzeveg, age 11, is a local school student. He has been working as a salesman in pelts and leather retail in a rental place at the local market since 2002. He is now planning to start his own animal pelt and leather business in that local market. He has a lot of experience in the field. He is requesting 3,600,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelts from herders and sell them to manufacturers. He is hardworking, friendly and a responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts from herders and sell them to manufacturers

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu has a general store, and she has devoted herself to this business activity for over 15 years. She has a very good clientele. This is because she has all types of products, and this is what the people look for nowadays.

She is very enterprising, and she says she really likes to help the people most in need. Her objective is to enlarge her place. This way she will be a source of work for more people.

She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables, milk, and other products. She will do this in order to be able to stock her store and to continue offering her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for her son to start his own business

loans.name: Vernus

texts.en: Vernus, 30 years old,  lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is married to a businessman and has two children, 8 and 12 years old, both in school and living at home. For the past three years, Vernus has been selling used clothes in her community market. She got money from her husband to start this business. Vernus is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She wants to buy land and to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her food business by purchasing tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, and other products. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, etc.

loans.name: Hector Arely

texts.es:
Héctor, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la producción de granos básicos, comprara insumos agropecuarios como el abono, herbicidas, tambien pagara mano de obra para realizar el trabajo.
Él manifiesta que obtuvo mejores ganancias con el cultivo anterior, porque adquirió todo lo necesario para realizar el trabajo, con estas ganancias compra lo necesario para las necesidades básicas del hogar, en su familia sus condiciones se mantienen y su núcleo familiar tambien.
texts.en:
Héctor has decided on a new loan to invest in the production of basic grains. He will buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer and herbicides and will also pay for the day labor needed to complete his work. 

He states that he received better earnings with the previous harvest because he was able to get everything he needed to realize his work. With these earnings he is buying what is necessary for his home's basic needs. His nuclear and extended family's conditions have been kept up.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for day labor.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old and stopped her education at grade 8. She is  married with two children aged  6 and 8  that live at home, and both of them attend school. For two years she has been selling charcoal  in her community. A problem she faces is  her small income but  she enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes  enables her to buy   food for her home and makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. In the near future she hopes  to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married and has four children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members (a brother). Jane has operated a tailoring business for five years. She works seven days every week in a shop that she rents. Jane's major business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread. Jane aspires to become a wholesaler, to buy more sewing machines and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Jane's monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials and thread

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, 32 years old, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in a house she’s rented for several years. Mwanakombo has a small store, selling basic staple goods and snacks, among others. She also provides milling services and sells beauty products. Mwanakombo is a very hardworking woman who does various things to have a stable life.

Mwanakombo is asking Yehu for a loan to buy larger amounts of products for her store to stock it with everything necessary. She will also buy cosmetics and other beauty products to subsequently sell from place to place. In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of products for her store

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
María, necesita dinero para poder invertir en el negocio, recibió una buena atención y necesita compra plátanos, aceite y leña, esto le ayudara a que María pueda mejorar su negocio y la disponibilidad para realizar sus ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el negocio, aumento las posibilidades de venta, gracias al crédito de Kiva ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas, en su familia todos se mantienen bien.
texts.en:
María needs money to be able to invest in her business, which has experienced a strong demand. She needs to buy plantains, oil, and firewood. This will help María to be able to improve her business and be available to make her sales.

With the previous loan, she strengthened her business and increased her potential sales. Thanks to the loan from Kiva, she has improved her financial conditions. In her family, everyone is doing well.

loans.use: to buy plantains, oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Alcides Aristides

texts.es:
Alcides, se dedica a la venta de sal, vive con su familia, está casado, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 7 años, dependen económicamente de él, Alcides inicio el negocio como un medio para mantener en el hogar lo necesario, aprendió el negocio de su padre, él procesa  la sal y la empaca para la venta.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de bolsas de empaque, tambien para pagar mano de obra, esto le ayudara a mejorar la producción y las ventas.
Su objetivo es a través del negocio mejorar su condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Alcides lives with his family and earns his living by selling salt. He is married and has two children (ages 5 and 7) who are financially dependent on him. Alcides started this business as a way of providing his household with whatever is needed. He learned this business from his father. Alcides processes the salt and then packages it for sale.

He is currently requesting a loan so that he can buy packing bags. Alcides will also pay for labor, which will help with both production and sales. His goal is to see that his business improves his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags for packaging salt and to pay for labor.

loans.name: El Pedregal Group

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es miembro del grupo El Pedregal, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estudio solo la secundaria, se encuentra casada, y tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad. Ella platica que hace un poco mas de 9 años inició a vender zapatos y cosméticos por catalogo, los cuales vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos. Ella primero lleva a mostrar sus catalogos, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y cuando su paquete llega lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos. Doña Alicia demas de vender sus zapatos y cosmeticos vende de lunes a viernes antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, tostadas. tacos, gorditas) y dulces en la primaria de su comunidad en la hora en la que los niños salen al recreo. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de catalogos, zapatos, perfumeria, cosmeticos, tomates, chiles, cebollas, carne, aceite, sal, crema, queso y gas. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio propere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y que en un furuto estudien una profesion para que puedan salir adelante.

 Los demas integrantes del grupo se llaman:
Isidra venta de comida
Blanca venta de ropa 
Edith venta de ropa 
Paula venta de refrescos
Indira venta de colchas
Olga venta de calzado 
Alvaro servicio electrico
Soila venta de refrescos
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the group "El Pedregal." She is 38 years old. She only completed her secondary education. She is married and has three children who attend the community's primary school. A little more than 9 years ago, she began to sell shoes and cosmetics through catalog sales. She sells door-to-door with her friends and neighbors. She first shows her catalogs, then takes an order, delivers it to her suppliers, and when the package arrives, she delivers it to her customers and receives the payment for the product. Besides selling shoes and cosmetics, Alicia sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes (empanadas, tostadas, tacos, gorditas) and candies from Monday to Friday at the community's primary schools during the children's recess time. She needs this loan in order to buy catalogs, shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, tomatoes, chiles, onions, meat, oil, salt, cream, cheese, and gas for the stove. She hopes that with this loan her business prospers since she wants to provide her children with a better quality of life, and in the future, the means to study a profession so that they can move forward.

The others members of the group are Isidra, who sells food; Blanca, who sells clothing; Edith, who sells clothing; Paula, who sells refreshments; Indira, who sells quilted cloths; Olga, who sells footwear; Alvaro, who is an electrician; and Soila, who sells refreshments.

loans.use: to purchase catalogs, shoes, perfume, cosmetics, ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Weatta

texts.en: Weatta live in West Point, Montserrado County, which is the most noted commercial city in Liberia. She is 31 years old, and has three children aged 5 months, 8 and 12 years old. For the past 2 years she has been selling oranges in the local market on a table. One of the problems she faces is little capital.  She enjoys the profit she makes every day which provides  money for her expenses. This makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges for her business. She dreams of building a house .

loans.use: to purchase more oranges for her business,

loans.name: Al Hawraa Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower of Al Hawraa's group. She got together with her other group members to request this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is seated on the right. She has been working in a clothes factory for 10 years, and does well in her business because of her special talent, good quality of production and reputation. She is a 43-year-old married woman and is the mother of three children (Ali-M-28, Nana-F-18 and Samar-F-15). She works hard to help her husband in making their living and covering their expenses.

Because of increasing family needs and requests, Fatima is going to start her own sewing business to increase their income. She will pursue this in addition to her job. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary sewing machine to start her own business.

Zeinab is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children (Bassam-M-14, Doha-F-12, Ali-M-7). She has worked in the cleaning department at a school for one year. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a washing machine that is necessary for her household needs.

Hilda is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of three children (Sara-F-16, Hassan-M-12, Ali-M-5). She has worked in the cleaning department at a school for one year. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a special updated sewing machine to start her own business

loans.name: Evelin Piedad

texts.es:
EVELIN PIEDAD tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, vive con el hijo y los padres en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

EVELIN PIEDAD se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama y caballero. Solicita el créeito para comprar mercadería, pantalones, calentadores, sueteres, camisetas. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar la mercadería para vender a los clientes. Los desafíos a los que se nefrenta es la competencia. 

El sueño es seguir cumpliendo con el negocio. En elt iempo libre le gusta reunirce con la familia.
texts.en:
Evelin Piedad is 22 years old and a single mother of a two-year-old son. She and her son live with her parents in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.

Evelin Piedad sells clothing for women and men. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise, trousers, leg warmers, sweaters, and T-shirts. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy goods to sell to her customers. The challenges she faces include dealing with the competition.

Her goal is to continue operating her business. In her free time, she enjoys getting together with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, trousers, leg warmers, sweaters, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
El Sr. Martín tiene viviendo en esta localidad desde hace ocho años, trabaja en una compañía como guardia de seguridad por las noches,donde tiene una antigüedad de cinco años.
Tiene la ilusión de terminar su casa ya que le faltan algunos detalles, tales como el enjarrar el cuarto de recámara y terminar el cuarto de baño es por eso que pide apoyo a Credituyo para llevar a cabo los proyectos que trae en mente y poder ofrecerle una vivienda sana a su hijo que muy pronto llegará de Estados Unidos de visita, con su hija y esposa. El Sr. Martín es una persona responsable y dedicado a su familia es por eso que siempre piensa en la comódidad de ellos.
texts.en:
Señor Martín has lived in this area for eight years. He works for a company as a night security guard; he has been doing this for five years.

He dreams of finishing his house, since it lacks a few details such as plastering the bedroom and finishing the bathroom. It is for this reason that he is asking for support from Credituyo to finish the projects that he has in mind and to be able to offer a healthy home to his son, who very soon will arrive from the United States on a visit, with his daughter and his wife. Sr. Martín is a responsible person who is dedicated to his family. It is for this reason that he always thinks of their comfort.

loans.use: to finish building a bathroom and plaster the bedroom

loans.name: Josepine

texts.en: Josephine live in West Point which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 28 years old, single and has a nine year old child that lives at home and attends school. For years she has been running a market table where she sells cold water fish and other fish. One of the problems she faces is that during the rainy season she doesn’t have a good spot to sell from.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit that she makes. Having food in her home makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold-water-fish and ocean-fish like cassava and butter nose fish to resell. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold-water-fish and ocean-fish like cassava fish and butter nose fish to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is 40 years old and married with six children, all of whom are still in school. She has always worked and been responsible and enterprising. She has a small business for selling fish located in her house. She has always worked doing what she likes the most. She is described as friendly and that's why her customers prefer her. She wants to buy materials to build a shop and that is why she has asked Yehu for a loan.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a shop

loans.name: Dúo Resusitado Group

texts.es: Duo Resucitado,  integrado por Cruz quien se dedica al cultivo de ejote, arveja, suchini, espinaca, tiene cultivado en diferentes lugares para cosechar cada cinco días y no estar sin trabajo y sin ingresos, Doña Cruz ya tiene 20 años en el negocio y saber todos los movimientos, entrega sus productos a una cooperativa ubicada en Santiago, siempre le ayudan sus dos hijos menores y que aun estudian, su esposo es seguridad de una empresa, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Cruz is a member of the group Duo Resucitado.  She makes a living in growing green beans, peas, zucchini, and spinach.  She has crops in different places in order to harvest every five days and to not be without work or without an income.

Cruz has already been working in this business for twenty years and knows about all the tasks.  She delivers her products to a cooperative located in Santiago.  Her young children always help her and they are still studying in school.  Her husband is a security guard at a company.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds and manure for her crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her crop.

loans.name: Maemge

texts.en: Maemge is 44 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 3 and 28 that are in school. All of them lives in West Point; one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado County. This area is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market.  She stopped attending school at the 9th grade. She has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper and other items in the local market for the past ten years. She uses a motor bike to get her goods to the wholesale center. The problem she faces is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to increase her sales (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper, etc).  Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to increase her sales (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, pepper, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for post-graduate courses.

loans.name: Vilma Cordelia

texts.es: Vilma Cordelia a sus 41 años de edad, casada con cuatro hijos de 15, 17, 19 y 20 años de edad los cuales tres de ellos estudian y uno trabaja, ella es una mujer que toda su vida ha trabajado para salir adelante, no es la primera vez que ha trabajado con Fundación,  en los créditos anteriores ha demostrado ser  una persona responsable, cumplidora con sus pagos ella posee una pulpería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación  donde ella vende granos básicos, cosméticos, dulces, golosinas ropa entre otros productos. Ella actualmente  está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, productos congelados, dulces y otros productos, Vilma está muy agradecida con  la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
Vilma is 41 years old, married, and has four children of the ages 15, 17, 19, and 20. Three of her children attend school and the other works. Vilma is a woman who has worked her life in order to get ahead. This is not the first time that she has worked with Fundación; in her previous loans, she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible person who complied with her payments.

She owns a small grocery store which is located in her home where she sells basic grains, cosmetics, clothing, frozen foods, sweets, and other products. Vilma is very grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy and sell food products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, boxes of matches, cigarettes, juices, soft drinks, candies, and cosmetics, among other things.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Venceremos está conformado por 8 integrantes,  siete son madres solteras con 14 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, y un hombre los cuales conforman  el banco Venceremos, todos son personas responsables, trabajadoras. Son originarios del municipio de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas decidieron unirse, y se apoyan mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas. Francis María es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco , ella tiene por actividad ecomica una pulpería ubicada en su casa, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestible de consumo diario como arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, sal, caja de fosforo, cigarros, jugos, gaseosas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta  productos comestible, y en un futuro no muy lejano poder incrementar sus ganancias. E banco comunal Venceremos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Venceremos” (We Will Overcome) consists of eight members.  Seven of the members are single mothers who are responsible for 14 children among them.  There is one male member.  All of them are responsible and hardworking individuals.  The members are originally from the town of Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  These individuals decided to join together so that they could support one another with their various business activites.

Francis María is the Communal Bank coordinator who is in charge of overseeing the group’s responsibilities.  Her business is a small convenience store that is located in her home.  She sells everyday food products such as rice, beans, bread, milk, and salt.  In addition, Francis sells boxes of matches, cigarettes, juices, and sodas.  The goal of her loan is to invest in operating capital for her business of buying and selling food products.  In the not-so-distant future, she would like to increase her earnings.  

The Communal Bank “Venceremos” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources so that they can have the means to earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, milk, salt, matches, cigarettes, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Sobeida Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Sobeida Auxiliadora de  52 años de edad, casada con tres hijos mayores e independiente. Sobeida se caracteriza por ser una mujer, trabajadora, responsable en sus pagos en tiempo y forma. es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicada en la zona de occidente del país. 
Gracias a su espíritu, y ganas de superación personal, tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, que consisten en vender productos comestible y en cantidades pequeñas como: sobre de shampoo, sobre de café, arroz, frijoles cosidos, aceite, huevos, pan, leche, jugos, gaseosas. Actividad que la desempeña desde hace ocho años y está ubicada en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para brindar buen servicio a sus clientes, y en futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. La rutina de trabajo de Sobeida es trabajar unas 14 horas diario ofreciendo sus productos a los pobladores de su comunidad. Sobeida Auxiliadora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sobeida Auxiliadora is 52 years old, married and has three adult children who are all independent.  Sobeida is known for being hardworking and responsible in making her payments in a timely manner.  She is a native of León, which is located in the western part of the country.

Thanks to her spirit and personal desire to succeed, she runs a small grocery store in which she sells products in small quantities such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, cooked beans, oil, eggs, bread, milk, juices and carbonated soft drinks.  Her store is located in her house and she has been running it now for eight years.

She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her store so that she can offer better service to her clients and in the near future generate more income.  Sobeida’s work routine is to work around 14 hours per day offering her products to the members of her community.

Sobeida Auxiliadora is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders provide for people with limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her small grocery store with products such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, cooked beans, oil, eggs, bread, milk, juices and carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Mawoline

texts.en: Mawoline lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 27 years old, and is married to a businessman. They have a 6 year old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past 2 years, Mawoline has been operating a shop in the local market where she sells slippers. She received a little money from her husband to start her business, and learned about the business from her mother. She likes her business because it makes money for her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She plans to build a house with her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Nuri 2 Group

texts.en:
Ninis is 38 years old, and has 5 children, including Anggi (14 years old) and Ikhsan (10 years old), who are still in school and a 2-year-old toddler, Nur. Her business sells fried chicken and is located 200 meters from her house. She has run this business for 4 years. Her business income will help her save up to buy a motor cycle and help her fulfill her family's needs more easily.

She will use this loan to buy a gas tube, chicken, and rice warmer. She plans to expand her business and have her own kiosk. She is excited for her business because she is the only one who sells fried chicken in her village. Buying more ingredients is the obstacle to running this business.

loans.use: to buy a gas tube, chicken, and rice warmers for her store.

loans.name: Ghina 2 Group

texts.en:
Khadija is the featured borrower of Ghina 2's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. She is seated in the middle. She has been working in clothing repair for 5 years and does well in her business because of her special talent in this domain. Khadija is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She works hard to help her husband in making a living and covering their expenses. She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to pay for her son's college fees.

Ghina is a 22-year-old single woman who has worked in a furniture gallery for 3 years. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a washing machine that is necessary for her parent's house.

Haifa is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of two children, who has done admin work for 15 years. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a studying desk for her son.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college fees

loans.name: Korto G.

texts.en: Korto lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is 21 years old and has a five year old child who is attending school and lives at home. For the past three years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She enjoys interacting with her customers and the profit she makes daily. Having money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. She faces the problem of high prices of food materials. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot, chicken feet, and pepper for her business. Her dream is to become a big business woman and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare rib, meat, pig foot, chicken feet, and pepper for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Susan Micaela

texts.es:
Susan tiene 22 años de edad, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que ella con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja como promotora en una tienda de venta de celulares y con el fruto de su trabajo solventa con gran esfuerzo sus estudios, ya que ella se encuentra estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas en una universidad de su ciudad. 

Cada día Susan se levanta muy temprano para ir a su centro de labores, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y luego estudia por las noches; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Susan está muy contenta y agradecida ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar la matrícula y mensualidad de su universidad y así poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Susan is 22 years old.  She is a young woman with a strong desire to get ahead, and for that reason she works very hard as a promoter in a cell phone store.  She works hard to pay for her studies and she is persuing a career in business administration at the university in her city.  

Every day, Susan gets up very early to go to the store - where she works about eight hours a day -  and later studies at night.  She feels she is getting ahead because she is responsible and is eager to improve her life and make her parents proud.

Susan is very grateful for the help she has received to pay her tuition and monthly enrollment fees at her university.  She is also happy to be able to continue fighting to make her greatest dream a reality:  "To finish school and support her family."

loans.use: to pay for tuition and monthly enrollment fees.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a humble 51-year-old woman from Msambweni.  She is the mother of five children. She is a merchant and sells firewood. This business generates reasonable amounts of daily income.  She is asking for the loan to buy bundles of firewood to sell. 

Her plans for the future are to improve her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is still in her retail shop, which is doing very well. She is one person who always takes advantage of every opportunity that comes across. She thanks Kiva lenders for their mercy and kindness, to help people of low income. She testifies that the previous loan was of great help to her.

Fatuma is asking for another loan that will enable her to stock up her retail shop's merchandise, with items like flour, snacks, soft drinks, and basic grains. Her aim is to grow her business and, probably, hire some employees.

loans.use: to stock up her retail shop's merchandise, with items like flour, snacks, soft drinks, and basic grains

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en:
Fatumata lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 32 years old, and she is married with three children ages 11 and 15, who are in school and live at home. For ten years now she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells soft drinks, cold water and bread. She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother. 

Fatumata likes her business because she makes a profit, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and bread for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, and bread for her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market towns in Montserrado county. She is 45 years old, and she is a widow who has five children, from 20 to 30 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home.

For the past three years Comfort has been selling bread and soft drinks in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business. She wishes to buy land and build a house for her children, one day.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and soft drinks for her business,

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko est une jeune dame de 31ans. Elle est mariée à un restaurateur et ils ont 03 enfants tous à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 10,08 et 03ans. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle fait le commerce de pagnes depuis 2003. Elle expose ses marchandises sur étalage et vend de différentes variétés de pagnes. Afin d’avoir une boutique et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises, revendre et pouvoir atteindre ses objectifs à l'avenir.
texts.en: Akoko is a young woman of 31 years. She is married to a restauranteur and they have three children, all in school. They are aged 10, 8, and 3 years. To lend a hand to her spouse for the household expenses, she has sold pagnes (colorful wax cloth) since 2003. She shows her merchandise in a stall and sells different varieties of pagnes. In order to have a store and to improve her family's living conditions, she is asking for a second loan from WAGES to buy merchandise, resell it, and be able to meet her future goals.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She is 47 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 9 to 27 years old. Two of them are in school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past 22 years she been selling body creams, spray, bath soap, etc. in her community. Rebecca received the money from her husband to start this business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, spray, bath soap, etc for her business. She wishes to buy land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, spray, bath soap, etc for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nambula, membre du groupe d’affaire  Dorcas, est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée à un commerçant et mère de 8 enfants  tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des œuvres d’art et cela fait plus de 10ans. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit va  lui servir de s’approvisionner en différentes œuvres d’arts  à marchander dans la rue. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et  prospérer dans son bussness. Madame Nambula remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: The borrower Nambula, member of the Dorcas business group, is an entrepreneur. She is 50 years old, married to a storekeeper, and mother of eight children, all in school. She has worked selling artwork for more than ten years. However, she has just finished 16 loan cycles with Hekima. This new loan will be used to stock up with different works of art to sell in the street. Her goal is to educate her children and to make her business prosper. Madame Nambula thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to buy different types of artwork

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Afin d’acheter un congélateur pour agrandir son commerce de jus de fruits, d’eau et de glaçon, madame Abla âgée de 37ans est mariée à un comptable et ils ont un enfant de 07ans qui va à l’école. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Avec les profits qu'elle réalisera, madame Abla veut avoir une boutique car son activité se déroule à domicile et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en: Madame Abla is asking for a loan order to buy a freezer to grow her business selling fruit juice, water, and ice. Madame Abla, 37 years old, is married to an accountant and they have one seven year old child who goes to school. One person helps Madame Abla with her business. With the profits that she will make, Madame Abla wants to have a store, because she runs from business from home, and to provide for her family's well being.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Zamu

texts.en:
Zamu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, and all her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house. The family has no access to piped water or to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.  

She sells green bananas at the market, on a retail basis. She also has a charcoal stall, where she earns additional income. She has been in business for the past 10 years. She works six days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She would like to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal, to resell.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal, to resell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 44 years old and is married with three children who are aged between 20 and 16 years old.

Damaris has a general store that she has been running for the past six years, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy cooking oil, maize flour, etc. to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu has been involved in food vending--selling from her home and door to door. She has been in this business for the last five years.

She has been improving her economic situation now that her small business is more stable. However, her cry is to see that she sells from a permanent place and even grows to own a hotel in future.

With this loan, she will increase her ingredients by purchasing flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children; all her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.  

She sells second-hand clothes at the market, on a retail basis. She also has a motorcycle, from which she gets additional income. She has been in business for the past seven years. She works seven days a week. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality.

Prossy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, to buy more bales of used clothes. Her aspirations are to open up a boutique selling first-class clothes and shoes, and to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and lives in Ndunyu Njeru. She is married and has three children, who are aged between 7 and 25 years.

Esther is a farmer. She has been engaged in farming for many years. She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in her farm.

She hopes to be the leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has six children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy management!" His biggest challenge is the "high cost of farm inputs." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "lelmet." He will use the loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "efficiency."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "record keeping."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" John replied "surplus to assist in payment of school fees."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: "cow, poultry" but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Âgée de 42ans, mère de 03 enfants tous à l’école, madame dédé est revendeuse de céréales à domicile. Elle exerce seule cette activité depuis 1990  et par moment rencontre des problèmes de méventes. Elle veut stocker des céréales c’est pour cela, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES. Avec le profit tiré de la vente, elle veut ouvrir un magasin et modifier plus le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en: This client is a 42-year old woman with three children, all in school. She sells cereals out of her home. She has been in this business on her own since 1990, and at the moment she is facing a  slump. She would like to stock up on cereals, which is why she is taking out her first loan with WAGES. She would like to use her profits to open a store and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Jastice

texts.en:
Jastice is married man aged 28 years old blessed with two children aged six and two. He is a passion fruit farmer and has been in the farm for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, till more land, and plant more passion fruit.  

The profits he earns from the sell of passion fruit will be used to repay the loan. His dream is to expand his passion fruit farm and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides and till more land

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu lives in West Point, Liberia, one of the most populated and well-known areas in Montserrado County. She is 30 years old and single. Bendu has three children between the ages of 3 and 7 years old. Two of her children are in school, and all of them live at home. For the past four years she been making and selling tea, fried eggs, and bread in her community. She spends six hours in her food shop. She received money from her oldest sister to start this business. Bendu requests a loan to purchase more tea, over-tea (fixed coffee), bread, milk, eggs, oil, and butter for her business. She wishes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more tea, over-tea (fixed coffee), bread, milk, eggs, oil, and butter for her business

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. He has two children and has been doing this work for five years. His primary income sources are milk, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "dairy keeping!" His biggest challenge is "drought conditions." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "lelan." Stanley will use the loan of KES 60,000 requested from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

Stanley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "fair interest rates." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "saving for the future."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked "How will this loan benefit your family?" Stanley replied "better nutrition and more disposable income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stanley owns the following: "cow, motorcycle" but does not own "pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV" but does not have "electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is grateful for the previous loan that was of great help to her. She is asking for another loan to invest in her grocery store. She tells us that she diversified her line of operation, but she also runs her food stall. Both businesses are doing well. Rukia will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her grocery.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her grocery.

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is 29 years old. He lives in Telavi District with his mother. Suliko requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Suliko requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Suliko has already rented a place in the center of the city. The place is very profitable to open a fast food stall, where he will sell doner. With the received credit, Suliko will purchase the stock of raw materials to make doner and a refrigerator for juices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a fast food stall and sell doner

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children do go to school. She sells secondhand clothes at the market on retail basis. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She has been in this business for the last three years. She works six days a week. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to buy a plot of land and build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 53 years old and married to Susan with five children. He does a quarry mining business in Ndunyu Njeru town. He sells the building stones and building blocks to various construction sites and it has been profitable.

This will be his first loan term and he plans to buy quarry equipment since this will enable him to increase his production. He also plans to buy more stock of stones and building blocks to sell. He anticipates to generate more profits, which he will use to boost his farming business by buying seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Chege hopes to buy more pieces of land for quarrying to therefore make more profits and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more quarry equipment

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with three children who are all in school.

Peter is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy seedlings and fertilizers for use in his farm. He is optimistic that his farm will do well after the loan.

He hopes to see his farm expand in the near future and to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 32 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with two children who are aged between eight and three years old. 

Ibrahim is a farmer and has been in it for the past six years. He has applied for his seventh loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use in his farm.

He hopes to improve his family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Guadalupe Mariela

texts.es:
Guadalupe Mariela,  originaria del  departamento de Masaya,Su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, la mama, el esposo y una hija menor de edad,  con 37 años de edad, posee su negocio propio, manifiesta que a raíz de que la situación económica no estaba muy bien, se resolvió a emprender su negocio y vio que se ganaba bien viajando a otros países y decidió en viajar a nuestro país hermano San salvador, este consiste en compra la mercadería aquí en Nicaragua tales como cerámica de barro, sillas abuelitas, cuadros pintados de pared, chinos de manilas, hamacas unipersonales y matrimoniales. Luego viaja hacia San Salvador y cuando viene de regreso también trae mercadería como perfumen, joyas de plata y ropa variada estos para varón y mujer, y ofrecerlas a sus clientes radicados en Masaya y que venden en  el mercado municipal.
Gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene 6 años en el mercado comercializando sus productos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superar, crecer mas en su negocio y darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Actualmenye ella Necesita comprar una mercadería  para surtir su negocio y del cual le estan demandando, entre los que se mencionan, productos de la Avon y la zermat (perfumeria), y ropa como blusas y pantalones variados, de tal manera que le de mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Mariela is a native of the department of Masaya. Her nuclear family is composed of four people: her mother, her husband, and one daughter who is still a minor. 

At 37 years old, Guadalupe Mariela has her own business. She explains that because the economic situation was not very good, she resolved to start her own business. She saw that traveling to other countries was profitable, and she decided to travel to San Salvador, in Nicaragua's sister country, El Salvador.
